programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Andrew Treagust from Brighton has always dreamed of becoming a snowboard instructor in New Zealand and hopes to persuade his spouse to make the bold move out there as a family. However, wife Emma cannot bear the thought of breaking the close bond between the couple's two-year-old son and his grandmother. Presented by Nicki Chapman

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a flat in North Yorkshire, a property in Leybourne, Kent, and a house in Cornwall before finding out who bought them at auction, and what they paid

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Darryl and Mark go on the hunt for more than Â£40,000 of unpaid rent, while Lawrence and Kev take on a window company on behalf of a former employee owed wages. Elsewhere, Marc and Tony help a customer who did not receive a penny from the sale of their car through a dealership

programme.title: Helicopter Heroes Down Under
programme.desc: A rodeo rider is thrown from his horse and former Royal Navy pilot Mike de Winton is scrambled to an emergency radio beacon in the Bush. Documentary following the work of British flying doctors and aircrew saving lives in Australia

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Antiques experts Caroline Hawley and David Harper help two teams in Leominster, Herefordshire, search for valuable items to take to auction. Plus, Tim Wonnacott shows off his dazzling knowledge of boats

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Regional News and Weather

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Zara helps a student who is addicted to drugs, and a mishap in Heston's scheduling results in him having to plan a lecture on modern technology at the last minute. Medical drama, starring Elisabeth Dermot Walsh and Owen Brenman

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates a murder at the Kembleford charity treasure hunt. General suspicion falls on a bereaved man who wants revenge, but Father Brown is determined to prove he is innocent. Mystery, starring Mark Williams

programme.title: Perfection
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the general knowledge quiz in which contestants can win a rolling jackpot that starts at Â£1,000, but only by achieving perfection. If they fail in their bid, the money is carried over to create a bigger cash prize in the following game

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple who are searching for their perfect rural retreat in Ceredigion, west Wales, on a budget of Â£300,000. He also visits one of the busiest bee colonies in the county

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: Antiques dealers Mark Franks and Philip Serrell travel to Stacey's Auctioneers in the market town of Rayleigh in Essex, where they bid for bargains that can later be sold on for profit and donated to their chosen charities

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: BBC London News
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: Party Political Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Labour Party

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Alex Jones host the live magazine show, with a team of roving reporters presenting stories of interest from around the UK, plus big-name studio guests

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Simon teaches the pupils the importance of vigilance as part of his social-awareness programme - although Lenny takes his advice a little too far when he suspects a local shop is a cover for criminal activity and enlists Darren to hold a stake-out. Barry returns, determined to come home no matter what it takes, while George is caught off-guard when his meddling mother Marjorie turns up unexpectedly and sets about insulting everyone with her superior attitude. However, she gets a shock when she meets her son's new girlfriend Carol. Wendy Craig guest stars

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: New series. Return of the domestic comedy. Sue is worried about Karen, who is having trouble fitting in with her new classmates, but the concerned mum's attempts to settle the matter via e-mail backfire in spectacular fashion. Jake has a confession to make and Ben (who is now taller than his father) is auditioning for a school musical about Spartacus - despite the fact that, as his family tries to remind him, he cannot actually sing. Hugh Dennis and Claire Skinner star as the exasperated parents, with Tyger Drew-Honey, Daniel Roche and Ramona Marquez

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: The Browns await the fruits of their fraud after faking Grandad's death to get a payout, but the insurance company starts to grow suspicious. Agnes struggles to keep him out of sight, as she has promised the money to Dermot and Maria, who are desperate to get a place of their own

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents action from the midweek Premier League fixtures, including Tottenham Hotspur v Manchester City at White Hart Lane and Chelsea v West Ham United at Stamford Bridge. Spurs were aiming to avenge a 6-0 thrashing in December's reverse fixture against the Citizens, while the Blues were expected to complete a double over their London rivals. Plus, a look back at last night's Merseyside derby between Liverpool and Everton at Anfield, as well as the key moments from Manchester United v Cardiff City, Norwich City v Newcastle United, Southampton v Arsenal, Swansea City v Fulham, Crystal Palace v Hull City, Aston Villa v West Bromwich Albion and Sunderland v Stoke City

programme.title: Film 2014
programme.desc: Claudia Winkleman, Danny Leigh and guest critic Tim Robey provide their thoughts on the latest big-screen releases. Up for discussion are crime thriller Out of the Furnace, starring Christian Bale and Woody Harrelson, relationship comedy That Awkward Moment, with Zac Efron, and Mark Wahlberg in Afghanistan-based adventure Lone Survivor

programme.title: Weatherview
programme.desc: Weather

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Single mother Helene hopes a move to Australia will prove a fresh start for her family following the death of her husband. Eldest daughter Nicole has helped raise her siblings since the bereavement and she is reluctant to be separated from her relatives in Northern Ireland. However, a week sampling life in Perth seems to bring her round to the idea of relocating, but they face a problem when their UK home is valued for less than they expected

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore properties about to be auctioned in Swanley in Kent, Crewe in Cheshire, and Tooting in south London. They then follow the sale and talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings and later return to review the progress they have made. Postponed from Tuesday

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: High Court enforcement officers Lawrence and Kev go in search of money owed at an airport, while sheriffs Pete and Dave try to recover the Â£3,600 a couple paid for a kitchen that was never installed, and help a customer who ran into problems with a car dealership

programme.title: Helicopter Heroes Down Under
programme.desc: A crew faces a difficult rescue after being called out to a woman who has fallen from a cliff, and a team airlifts a baby to a specialist care unit in Sydney. Documentary following the work of British flying doctors and aircrew saving lives in Australia. Last in the series

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Philip Serrell and Henry Meadows offer advice to antique-hunters at the Royal Cornwall Showground in Wadebridge. Tim Wonnacott visits the tidal island of St Michael's Mount, where he learns about the important role played by a clock

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: A former social worker appears to be the victim of harassment by local youths, and Daniel tries to work out why they have targeted him in particular. Zara aims to please Mrs Tembe by doing her a favour, so she spends the afternoon tangling with the phone system at the surgery

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The mayor is electrocuted while speaking at the Kembleford village fete, and Father Brown suspects he was the victim of a deliberate act. Meanwhile, Mrs McCarthy's past comes back to haunt her. Mystery, starring Mark Williams and Sorcha Cusack

programme.title: Perfection
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the general knowledge quiz in which contestants can win a rolling jackpot that starts at Â£1,000, but only by achieving perfection. If they fail in their bid, the money is carried over to create a bigger cash prize in the following game

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Presenter Jonnie Irwin helps a recently retired couple search for a home in rural Suffolk on a budget of Â£500,000. They want to move from the urban North East to enjoy a different pace of life in the countryside. Meanwhile, away from the property search, Jonnie learns about the historic legacy of the Hawker Hurricane fighter aircraft

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: Antiques dealers Mark Franks and Philip Serrell travel to the Belgian town of Sint-Truiden, where they trawl through the market stalls in the hope of finding the best bargains. When they return to Britain, they attempt to sell their purchases with the aim of making the most profit for their chosen charities

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: BBC London News
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Alex Jones present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Poppy is annoyed when Fat Boy tells her it's not her place to meddle in Nick and Dot's relationship - but when she later sees him talking to Denise, he is forced to make a confession. Can the young couple survive this latest setback? Mick finds himself torn between his wife and sister once again, and all attempts to talk Shirley round prove hopeless, while Nancy is forced to admit her failure to help family pooch Lady Di keep her honour. Masood cuts his hand and Carol insists on cleaning it, but he mistakes her concern for affection

programme.title: Hidden Kingdoms
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on small creatures in an urban setting. In Rio de Janeiro, marmosets use power-lines as they would tree branches to scour the streets for food, and one animal becomes separated from its group and is forced to the ground, where it confronts the dangers of the city alone. Almost 11,000 miles away in the neon metropolis of Tokyo, a rhinoceros beetle begins an extraordinary journey to find sanctuary on a rare patch of greenery, along the way facing predatory bats, eight-eyed jumping spiders, praying mantises and a sharp-eyed crow. Including Hidden Kingdoms Revealed, showing how the film was made. Narrated by Stephen Fry. Last in the series

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jack turns out to have a personal connection to the prime suspect in a teenage girl's murder, so he is taken off the case and replaced with another forensic scientist seconded to the Lyell Centre. But he finds himself instinctively drawn into the investigation, alienating himself from Nikki and the team as he tries to find an alibi for the supposed killer. Meanwhile, the victim's best friend is consumed with guilt, leading her to take drastic action. Crime drama, starring David Caves, Emilia Fox and Richard Lintern, with guest appearances by Haydn Gwynne and Ashley Walters. Concludes tomorrow

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs a topical debate from Norwich, with panellists including Kenneth Clarke MP answering questions from the audience

programme.title: This Week
programme.desc: Andrew Neil presents round-table chat, in which he and his guests take a light-hearted romp through the political and parliamentary developments of the past seven days. They'll be discussing who is making the headlines and the issues that matter to both MPs and the public

programme.title: Skiing Weatherview

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: The Randall family contemplates emigrating to New Zealand, several years after mum Judy pushed for the move, only to change her mind. She has regretted her decision ever since and hopes to convince husband Chris to revert to their original plan with a trial stay in the capital, Auckland. Son Josh, however, is determined to stay in the UK. Last in the series

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts visit a cafe with a first-floor flat in Pembrokeshire, a three bedroom mid-terraced house in London and a two bedroom mid-terrace in Stoke-on-Trent, then follow the sales at auction and talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Darryl and Mark try to help a family whose life savings were spent on a horse box that proved to be unfit for the road, while Lawrence and Kev visit a builder who owes Â£20,000 for a project that barely got off the ground

programme.title: Helicopter Heroes Down Under
programme.desc: A freak wave leaves a surfer badly hurt and Dr Sarah McNeilly, originally from London, flies to the Outback to treat an Aborigine rock star who is critically ill. Documentary following the work of British flying doctors and aircrew saving lives in Australia

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Tim Wonnacott oversees proceedings as Christina Trevanion and Paul Laidlaw help the red and blue teams hunt for treasures at the Mona Showground in Anglesey. They then head to Knutsford in Cheshire to watch the items go under the hammer

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Zara and Daniel face a challenge when they take Joe to church for the first time and, on a quiet Sunday shift, Rob reluctantly investigates the theft of a laptop - but risks laying the blame on the wrong person

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest's priceless Blue Cross is targeted by infamous criminal Flambeau, so taking matters into his own hands Father Brown sets out to try to save the thief's soul, but risks falling into a trap. Mystery, starring Mark Williams

programme.title: Perfection
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the general knowledge quiz in which contestants can win a rolling jackpot that starts at Â£1,000, but only by achieving perfection. If they fail in their bid, the money is carried over to create a bigger cash prize in the following game

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps a country-loving couple find their dream home in Devon for Â£500,000, and meets a local farmer who has decided to use his south Devon cows to produce milk rather than beef

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: Mark Franks and Philip Serrell face the antiques showdown, making purchases at all four of their regular buying locations before selling at least half of them at auction. In their battle for premium profits, one dealer risks everything on a single item - and waits with bated breath to see if his boldness will pay off

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: BBC London News
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Chris Evans and Alex Jones present the final show of the week, featuring the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Ex-England cricketer Mark Butcher, Sydney Olympics gold medal-winning heptathlete Denise Lewis, world champion canoeist David Florence and former swimmer Mark Foster join team captains Phil Tufnell and Matt Dawson for another round of the quiz. Presented by Sue Barker

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: As Carol is telling her daughters about another hospital appointment, David finds himself the focus of someone else's attentions. But is Nikki really his type? The Carters are thrown when another member of the family, Aunt Babe, turns up out of the blue with a spot of advice for Shirley, who has been deeply affected after visiting her father. Tamwar is happy when Masood agrees to take on the market sweeper's job - only for his dad to later make a fool of himself when he sees Carol and David together in the Vic

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: German comedian Henning Wehn, West End star Michael Ball and actress-presenter Caroline Quentin reveal their pet hates to Frank Skinner, in the hope he will banish them to Room 101. Things that really get on the guests' nerves this week include fundraising, clairvoyants and junk mail

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Part two of two. Jack's world falls apart with the discovery of another body, and he begins to doubt Ryan's innocence - but his attempts to find evidence anger Thomas, who is considering taking on his replacement Helen in a full-time capacity. Meanwhile, Nikki uncovers the truth about her colleague's strained relationship with the suspect, and when his lone investigation puts him in grave danger, it seems Jack's life will never be the same again. Last in the series

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Graham meets Matthew McConaughey, talking about his Golden Globe-winning performance in Dallas Buyers Club, Julianne Moore, starring in the action movie Non-Stop, comedian, actor and QI panellist Alan Davies, and singer-songwriter Sheryl Crow. Plus, more audience members will take their chance in the dreaded red chair

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker and a selection of guests review the latest news and reaction to the day's signings, as the clubs finalise their squads for the remaining months of the season. While teams in the Football League will be able to make `emergency loan' transfers in a week's time, those in the Premier League and Scottish Premiership will have to wait until the end of the season, something that should prompt the traditional scramble to push last-minute deals through before the window closes

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Omnibus. Shirley reluctantly joins Mick and Tina on a visit to their father in the hope he will give them the money they need to keep the Vic afloat - but at the last minute she decides she can't go through with it. Back at the pub, Linda isn't convinced her father-in-law is the answer to the family's financial worries, so Johnny comes up with a possible solution. But how will she feel about breeding her much-loved pooch? Carol decides she is going to tell dad Jim about her cancer, but Max pleads with her not to. Veteran actor Timothy West joins the cast

programme.title: Weatherview
programme.desc: Weather

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: James Martin is joined by chefs Ken Hom and Ching-He Huang, and invites The Musketeers actress Maimie McCoy to face her food heaven or hell. Plus, wine expert Susie Barrie chooses drinks to match the dishes being prepared and there are highlights from the archives including clips from Celebrity MasterChef and programmes featuring Rick Stein and Simon Hopkinson

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: The return of the show featuring recipes, tips and discussions on the latest food trends, beginning with a look at how to reduce food waste and save money. Host Michel Roux Jr and resident drinks expert Kate Goodman are joined by The Great British Bake Off judge Mary Berry, who uses stale bread to create a fish-pie topping and shares stories of her days as freezer correspondent in the 1960s. Kate does a tasting of grappa - which is made from a by-product of wine-making - and there is debate about whether food is too cheap

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker and guests look ahead to the weekend's action, including today's early kick-off in the Premier League between Newcastle United and Sunderland at St James' Park. Plus, a preview of Monday evening's potentially crucial clash at the Etihad Stadium between title contenders Manchester City and Chelsea

programme.title: Saturday Sportsday
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest sports news, including a look ahead to today's important fixtures and events

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: General News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Jonathan Pratt and Henry Meadows help two teams search for profitable items at an antiques fair at Merseyside's Aintree racecourse. Meanwhile, Tim Wonnacott visits the Walker Art Gallery in Liverpool to discover how three seemingly unrelated objects are connected

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: Wales v Italy (Kick-off 2.30pm). Jason Mohammad presents coverage of the opening match of the 2014 championship, as Wales begin their quest for a third successive title at the Millennium Stadium in Cardiff. Their fans will remember 2013 as a banner year for Welsh rugby, as they not only sealed last year's Six Nations with a comprehensive victory at home to England in the final match, but coach Warren Gatland led a Lions squad containing a large Welsh contingent to victory on their tour of Australia. Gatland missed the entire Six Nations campaign last year while he continued his rehabilitation from two broken heels suffered while on holiday, leaving assistant coach Robert Howley to lead the nation in his absence, but the New Zealander returns for this match looking to continue Wales' excellent record of never having lost at home to the Azzurri. With commentary by Andrew Cotter and Jonathan Davies, and analysis from Martyn Williams and Shane Williams

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: France v England (Kick-off 5.00pm). John Inverdale is joined by Clive Woodward, Jeremy Guscott and Thomas Castaignede to present coverage of the second match of the opening weekend of the championship, which takes place at the Stade de France in Paris. While England suffered the disappointment of missing out on last year's title to Wales after losing their final match 30-3 in Cardiff, France suffered the ignominy of finishing at the foot of the table with just one win and one draw from their five matches, despite starting out as one of the favourites for victory. England will be buoyed by their recent record against Les Bleus coming into this contest, having won six of the last eight meetings between the two, including a 23-13 victory at Twickenham last year, as well as three of the last four matches at the French national stadium. Commentary by Eddie Butler and Brian Moore

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: General News/Current Affairs

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: The competition forges ahead with the fourth round of the blind auditions and the coaches' continuing campaigns to build a 12-strong team. As ever, the fun starts whenever more than one coach wants the same singer and argue why they would make the best mentor. Emma Willis and Marvin Humes are backstage with the contestants' families

programme.title: The National Lottery
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the game show in which two pairs of strangers team up, each battling to outdo the other by listing as much as they know about a given subject. The first couple to win two rounds get to play for Â£100,000 and each time the champions defeat a new set of opponents their winnings mount up. Includes the Lotto and Thunderball draws presented by Kate Garraway

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Rita helps a rape victim gain the courage to press charges, while Zoe treats an eccentric veteran dancer who must face up to telling the truth about the daughter she put up for adoption

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League clashes, which included Newcastle United v Sunderland at St James' Park and Stoke City v Manchester United at the Britannia Stadium. The Magpies were looking to improve on a run of four matches against their local rivals without victory, while the champions were aiming to defeat Mark Hughes' men for the third time this season. Plus, action from West Ham United v Swansea City, Cardiff City v Norwich City, Everton v Aston Villa, Fulham v Southampton and Hull City v Tottenham Hotspur

programme.title: The Football League Show
programme.desc: Manish Bhasin presents highlights and all the goals from today's fixtures in the Championship, League One and League Two, including Queens Park Rangers v Burnley at Loftus Road, as two of the leading contenders for promotion to the Premier League met. Plus, action from Sheffield Wednesday v Barnsley and Leeds United v Huddersfield Town

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a flat in Lewisham, south-east London, a mid-terraced house in Gilesgate, Co Durham, and a former ambulance hall in Neath, West Glamorgan, before finding out what they sold for at auction. After three months the team returns to review the buyers' progress

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: High Court enforcement officers leave a jewellery shop owner with considerable debt after he mis-sold an engagement ring to a young couple. The sheriffs also visit a removal company that damaged customers' belongings

programme.title: Helicopter Heroes Down Under
programme.desc: New medic James Milligan swaps Leeds General Infirmary for a first-aid class in the Bush, and a child is hurt after a freak accident in a theme park. Documentary following the work of British flying doctors and aircrew saving lives in Australia

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Pies & Puds
programme.desc: The baker rustles up a luxurious black pudding sausage plait and a nostalgic dessert flavoured with black liquorice, before demonstrating how to create his take on the classic black forest trifle

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team travel to the Sainsbury Centre for Visual Arts at the University of East Anglia, Norwich, where members of the public bring along treasured antiques and collectibles to hear their stories and find out their worth. Items include the death mask of 19th-century prime minister William Gladstone, a complete kitchen from the 1950s, a horn found by a soldier serving in Afghanistan and a sampler sewn by the resident of a Victorian lunatic asylum - complete with hand-made accusations aimed at those responsible for her incarceration

programme.title: Rip Off Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford unravels the tricks used by some food manufacturers and supermarkets, and unearths the hidden rip-offs that could be lurking in the average consumer's fridge. She reveals how some companies create fictional place names to make food more attractive to customers and why a product described as one of a shopper's five-a-day could actually be harmful. Plus, the soups that contain less than the label promises

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: A look at the work of the British Deaf History Society and its new museum launch in Warrington, as well as a project at the Deaf Association that intends to reveal a treasure trove of old film archives. Plus, a feature on hard-of-hearing director Ted Evans and his personal journey to explore his local history in the East End of London. With voiceover

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Coverage of Prime Minister's Questions from the House of Commons at 12.00, interspersed with discussions, interviews and reports from around the country. Presented by Andrew Neil and Jo Coburn

programme.title: Britain's First Photo Album
programme.desc: John Sergeant visits the remains of Victorian photographer Francis Frith's home in Reigate, Surrey, before investigating medieval smugglers' haunts in Rye, East Sussex. He also finds out where the riflemen of the British Army learnt their skills in the 18th century, and takes a photograph to capture the modern setting of Frith's pictures

programme.title: Cash in the Attic
programme.desc: Widow June Jailler wishes to raise some money for the hospice that took care of her late husband, so calls on the services of Jules Hudson and Curtis Dowling to assist her in identifying antiques and collectibles that will secure the required funds when sold on

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining contestants test their bread-making skills as they embark on a series of challenges. After cooking a flavoured loaf, they face the task of baking focaccia. A display basket featuring 24 rolls forms the final leg of the challenge, before the judges reveal who will leave the competition. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team journeys from Cornwall to south Wales, with Neil Oliver visiting the site of a 1945 Welsh great escape, when almost 70 German PoWs made a bid for freedom over the sand dunes at Bridgend. Renee Godfrey swims with seals off Lundy Island, Nick Crane undertakes an epic climb and Hermione Cockburn looks at a remarkable building project

programme.title: The Secret Life of Elephants
programme.desc: The rains arrive in Kenya following the drought and elephant calf Breeze faces a fight for survival in the harsh conditions. Hundreds of elephants then descend on the reserve for the breeding season, and the research team prepares for the busiest period of the year. Using new technology, Saba Douglas-Hamilton tracks the bulls, but keeps a wary eye on rogue male Rommel. Last in the series

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin meets people in Leicester eager to make a profit selling their valuables at auction, with expert advice from Adam Partridge and Charlie Ross. In a programme recorded before the discovery of Richard III's remains beneath a car park in the city, Paul investigates the bad reputation the last king of the House of York reportedly had and travels to the site of the Battle of Bosworth in which he was killed

programme.title: Party Political Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Labour Party

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the next leg of his journey, Michael Portillo heads along the Essex bank of the Thames before crossing the river into Kent. He begins in Barkingside, where Victorian philanthropist Thomas Barnardo made it his mission to transform the lives of destitute children. The former politician then tries his hand at loading a container onto a pocket wagon at Tilbury docks, and ends his trip in Rochester, where he encounters a host of familiar characters and explores a town that was an inspiration for many of Charles Dickens' works

programme.title: The Great Interior Design Challenge
programme.desc: The final heat sees another trio of contestants take up the challenge as they redesign the living rooms of three Regency homes in Brighton, with the hopefuls choosing designs inspired by Hollywood, family fun and a French country kitchen. Presenter Tom Dyckhoff explores the history of the properties and the Regency era, before judges Sophie Robinson and Daniel Hopwood decide who will progress to the quarter-finals

programme.title: The Restaurant Man
programme.desc: New series. Restaurateur Russell Norman gives people the benefit of his experience during the crucial few months before and after they open their establishments for business. In the first edition, he helps Rich and Matt with their concept for an edgy burger bar in Southampton, which is plagued by problems with the food, the service and the layout of the restaurant

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Doctors Chris and Xand van Tulleken, who are identical twins, go on month-long diets comprising high volumes of fat or sugar to find out which is worse for the human body. The effects on their health are both shocking and surprising, but they also discover their biggest enemy may have been hiding in plain sight

programme.title: Mock the Week - Again
programme.desc: Dara O Briain hosts the comedy quiz, with guests Chris Addison, Ed Byrne, Micky Flanagan and Diane Morgan joining panellists Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons to offer opinions on world events in an edition from 2011

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Jeremy Paxman

programme.title: Inside the Animal Mind
programme.desc: Combining remarkable demonstrations of abilities with revealing photography, Chris Packham travels the world to uncover the secrets of animals' intelligence, emotions and self-awareness. The first episode explores the remarkable ways creatures use their senses, examining how dogs' powerful ability to detect smell creates a bizarre alternative reality for them

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: A look at the work of the British Deaf History Society and its new museum launch in Warrington, as well as a project at the Deaf Association that intends to reveal a treasure trove of old film archives. Plus, a feature on hard-of-hearing director Ted Evans and his personal journey to explore his local history in the East End of London. With voiceover

programme.title: James May's Toy Stories
programme.desc: The Top Gear presenter sets out to build a motorbike and sidecar entirely out of Meccano and complete a lap of the Isle of Man's TT circuit. A total of 15,000 pieces must be assembled to create a full-size, road-legal motorcycle that James hopes will be more than a match for one of the world's most demanding courses - as well as bearing the weight of himself and passenger Oz Clarke

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Schools - Beneath the Lab Coat
programme.desc: Rani Price investigates the science behind new technologies, including space travel and cybernetics, and talks to the people at the forefront of the breakthroughs

programme.title: Schools - Spark
programme.desc: Nine adults talk about why they enjoy their jobs and reflect on the moments in their childhoods that sparked their rewarding careers

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a flat in North Yorkshire, a property in Leybourne, Kent, and a house in Cornwall before finding out who bought them at auction, and what they paid

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Darryl and Mark go on the hunt for more than Â£40,000 of unpaid rent, while Lawrence and Kev take on a window company on behalf of a former employee owed wages. Elsewhere, Marc and Tony help a customer who did not receive a penny from the sale of their car through a dealership

programme.title: Helicopter Heroes Down Under
programme.desc: A rodeo rider is thrown from his horse and former Royal Navy pilot Mike de Winton is scrambled to an emergency radio beacon in the Bush. Documentary following the work of British flying doctors and aircrew saving lives in Australia

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Pies & Puds
programme.desc: The baker is given an exclusive look at the drawings of the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge's wedding cake by designer Fiona Cairns. Plus, he samples the best Scottish heather honey, and fish curries get a pie makeover

programme.title: Tudor Monastery Farm
programme.desc: Ruth Goodman, Peter Ginn and Tom Pinfold bring in the barley and celebrate with a harvest feast, while Ruth prepares for winter by salting meat to preserve it. As the team plans to put on a mystery play, Tom creates fireworks with an alchemist, while Ruth and Peter help with props and costumes. Preparing to leave the farm, they reflect on what they have learned and contemplate what the dissolution of the monasteries meant for the kingdom. Last in the series

programme.title: Rip Off Food
programme.desc: Gloria Hunniford unravels more tricks used by some food manufacturers and supermarkets, and unearths the hidden rip-offs that could be lurking in the average consumer's fridge. In this edition, she investigates the sugar content of products marketed as healthy options and reveals the truth about flavoured water. Plus, the ingredients in some diet foods that could also be used in decorating

programme.title: HARDtalk
programme.desc: Stephen Sackur talks to people making the headlines

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: BBC World News
programme.desc: The latest international headlines

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Andrew Neil and Jo Coburn

programme.title: Britain's First Photo Album
programme.desc: John Sergeant begins today's pictorial journey on the Isle of Wight, where he visits one of the oldest theme parks in the world. He also samples the produce of a Hampshire brewing town and uses images from Victorian photographer Francis Frith's archive to learn more about Stonehenge

programme.title: Cash in the Attic
programme.desc: Jennie Bond and Jonty Hearnden help passionate hoarder Keith Yaxley clear space in his home. He has decided to sell some of his cherished possessions at auction to help fund a dream wedding to his fiancee Aicha

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining bakers test their biscuit-making skills as they embark on a series of challenges. After cooking their own interpretation of a classic, the contestants face the task of baking brandy snaps. Preparing a display of macaroons forms the final leg of the challenge, before the judges reveal who will leave the competition. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team embarks on a tour of the southern shoreline of Ireland. In Cork, Neil Oliver explores the last port visited by the ill-fated Titanic, while Miranda Krestovnikoff heads for Co Wexford for an encounter with the white-fronted goose. Elsewhere, Dick Strawbridge takes a ride on Brunel's Folly, a railway line that clings to the Bray Head cliffside on a perilous route between Dublin and Wicklow

programme.title: Lost Land of the Tiger
programme.desc: Alan Rabinowitz, Gordon Buchanan, George McGavin, Steve Backshall and Justine Evans travel to the far-flung corners of the Himalayas in search of tigers, snow leopards and clouded leopards, on an expedition aimed at helping the survival of these creatures. The team gets to work by tracking elusive tigers and setting up remote-controlled cameras to film the animals in action

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Jethro Marles and Philip Serrell travel to Penzance to examine a range of items going up for auction, while Paul Martin heads off to see what is being crafted at the Newlyn Copper Works

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo starts the next leg of his journey to Chichester in Faversham, Kent, where he visits Shepherd Neame, which is one of the oldest breweries in Britain. He then heads to Dover to explore a sunken fortress known as the Western Heights, before crossing into Surrey where he blow-dries a hen in Dorking

programme.title: The Great Interior Design Challenge
programme.desc: Four heat-winners take part in the first quarter-final, in which they have 48 hours to transform thatched cottages in Milton Abbas, Dorset, with the help of a builder and a budget of Â£1,000. Tom Dyckhoff examines the history of this Georgian model village, before judges Sophie Robinson and Daniel Hopwood decide which two contenders go through to the semi-final

programme.title: Restoration Home One Year On
programme.desc: Kieran Long revisits Gavin and Anne, who worked for a year on the Elms, a three-storey Georgian mansion in Derbyshire, before running out of money. A year later, Gavin has painstakingly reinstated the original staircase, but there is much intricate work still to do. Kieran then heads to North Yorkshire, where he finds Heather and Nick are closer than ever to bringing Coulton Mill back to life, and the recent restoration of the ancient farm buildings has rejuvenated crafts and skills that were close to being lost for ever

programme.title: Dan Snow's History of the Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Historian Dan Snow looks back at 90 years of the Winter Olympics, examining the impact of the political upheaval during the 20th and 21st centuries. He examines the Games held in Nazi Germany in 1936 and the tense rivalry between East and West during the Cold War. Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean reminisce about their gold medal-winning performance in Sarajevo in 1984 and Dan tells the story of British man Arnold Lunn's role in the development of the Alpine skiing disciplines of downhill and slalom racing

programme.title: Charlie Brooker's Weekly Wipe
programme.desc: The writer and broadcaster offers a satirical look at the latest news from politics, the media and the internet, casting a critical eye over trends in TV, cinema, computer games and social media. Featuring contributions by Doug Stanhope, Brian Limond, Jake Yapp, Al Campbell and Diane Morgan

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Doctors Chris and Xand van Tulleken, who are identical twins, go on month-long diets comprising high volumes of fat or sugar to find out which is worse for the human body. The effects on their health are both shocking and surprising, but they also discover their biggest enemy may have been hiding in plain sight

programme.title: Putin's Games - Panorama
programme.desc: A report on the real cost of the Winter Games in Russia, which has quadrupled to a record-breaking Â£30billion. John Sweeney looks into allegations that lucrative contracts were handed to President Putin's friends and investigates claims that, despite the huge cost, thousands of workers haven't been paid - some even saying they were tortured when they tried to protest

programme.title: Pilgrimage with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Author and broadcaster Simon Reeve retraces the steps of British pilgrims, exploring the faith, hopes, desires and even the food that helped keep them on the road. In the first episode he sets out on a journey to Canterbury, beginning at the Holy Island of Lindisfarne off the coast of Northumberland, one of the earliest sites of Christian pilgrimage in Britain

programme.title: Sacred Wonders of Britain
programme.desc: Neil Oliver travels to Iona in the Inner Hebrides to learn about St Columba's tough brand of monasticism, and finds out how the epic journey of St Cuthbert led to the writing of the Lindisfarne Gospels and the building of Durham Cathedral. At Canterbury Cathedral, Neil discovers how the gruesome murder of Thomas Becket spurred the building of its nave, and on Glastonbury Tor in Somerset, he investigates the story of the Holy Grail, the sacred cup of everlasting life. Last in the series. Postponed from January 24

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Schools - The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-time
programme.desc: A look at how the National Theatre turned one of Britain's most popular books by Mark Haddon into a multi-award-winning theatre production

programme.title: Schools - Labrinth's Speak Out
programme.desc: Musician Labrinth explores ways for people to utilise their voices, revealing techniques for situations including newsreading and being a tour guide. He sends youngsters out to try their new oratory skills and explains how to speak with confidence and clarity

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore properties about to be auctioned in Swanley in Kent, Crewe in Cheshire, and Tooting in south London. They then follow the sale and talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings and later return to review the progress they have made. Postponed from Wednesday

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: High Court enforcement officers Lawrence and Kev go in search of money owed at an airport, while sheriffs Pete and Dave try to recover the Â£3,600 a couple paid for a kitchen that was never installed, and help a customer who ran into problems with a car dealership

programme.title: Helicopter Heroes Down Under
programme.desc: A crew faces a difficult rescue after being called out to a woman who has fallen from a cliff, and a team airlifts a baby to a specialist care unit in Sydney. Documentary following the work of British flying doctors and aircrew saving lives in Australia. Last in the series

programme.title: Paul Hollywood's Pies & Puds
programme.desc: The baker is joined by cake decorator Adam Cox to sample a pina colada pudding topped with a miniature version of himself reclined under a palm tree. Paul also explores how pies bring flavours together, focusing on rabbit and pancetta dishes and a classic serving of Yorkshire apple and Wensleydale cheese. Last in the series

programme.title: Cold War, Hot Jets
programme.desc: Britain emerged from the Second World War in financial crisis, but the development of the jet engine provided hope for the future and resulted in a world-leading aviation industry. In the first of a two-part documentary, historian and author James Holland examines how the jet became a lucrative export and a powerful piece of military hardware during the Cold War, and looks at how selling to the wrong buyer could alter the balance of power

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs a topical debate from Norwich, with panellists including Kenneth Clarke MP answering questions from the audience

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: BBC World News
programme.desc: The latest international headlines

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country, presented by Andrew Neil

programme.title: Britain's First Photo Album
programme.desc: John Sergeant travels to Dorset in south-west England to find out how much has changed since Francis Frith took photos of the county, visiting an ancient watermill in Lyme Regis and Exeter Guildhall's dungeons. He also learns about the techniques required to farm with horses

programme.title: Cash in the Attic
programme.desc: Lorne Spicer and Paul Hayes help Wendy and Colin Turner raise funds for a special gift for their paralysed son Simon. They hope to buy him equipment so he can complete his art degree

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: The remaining bakers test their pie-making skills as they embark on a series of challenges. After serving up their signature dish for judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood, they are faced with cooking six individual pork pies - a task that proves problematic for vegetarian Jason - and preparing a meringue. Presented by Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team explores Britain's connection to the fjords of Norway, with Neil Oliver discovering how a raid on the Nazi-occupied Lofoten Islands helped turn the tide of the Second World War in the favour of the Allied forces. Mark Horton meets shipwrights who build boats using the centuries-old methods of the Vikings, and Jason Roberts braves the frozen landscapes of Svalbard in search of the perfect picture of a wild polar bear

programme.title: Lost Land of the Tiger
programme.desc: From the base camp in the Himalayas, the team moves out to track down tigers throughout Bhutan. Steve Backshall is pushed to the limits of his physical endurance when he takes on a white water river in the eastern jungles, and Gordon Buchanan deploys remote cameras and uses a fingerprinting technique to identify individual cats. Meanwhile, biologist Dr George McGavin meets the predator during a trip to India

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Presenter Paul Martin takes a nostalgic look at the seaside holiday and explores the resort of Eastbourne in East Sussex. Mark Stacey and Jethro Marles take a look at the locals' antiques and collectibles in the town hall

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo is in Brighton as he starts the final leg of his journey from Norwich to Chichester, learning about the history of the Royal Pavilion. At Bramber, he discovers that Victorian tourists flocked to the town in huge numbers to visit a museum of taxidermy, before heading into the South Downs for a taste of life in the fast lane at Goodwood. Last in the series

programme.title: The Great Interior Design Challenge
programme.desc: The remaining four heat-winners take part in the second quarter-final, in which they have 48 hours to transform bedrooms in a 1950s tower block in Bethnal Green, east London, with the help of a builder and a budget of Â£1,000. Tom Dyckhoff examines the history of the block and how it was rescued from demolition to become one of the area's more desirable places to live, before judges Sophie Robinson and Daniel Hopwood decide which two contenders go through to the semi-final

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to take their place in the black chair, where they answer questions on the specialist subjects of alt-rock band Manic Street Preachers, the life of mountaineer Edmund Hillary, the history of Kew Gardens and the ghost stories of MR James. They then have a chance to demonstrate their general knowledge in the final round

programme.title: An Island Parish
programme.desc: Sark hosts a talent competition in aid of charity, with the acts including children's choirs, comedians and a man dressed as a chicken clucking the theme to Match of the Day. Elsewhere, Methodist lay preacher Karen Le Mouton is having a stressful time as she seeks to clear the final hurdle to being accepted for ordination while her mother lies terminally ill at home

programme.title: Vultures
programme.desc: Cameraman and naturalist Charlie Hamilton James travels to eastern Africa to try to show a different side to the much-maligned vulture, which he believes is a beautiful and intelligent bird that deserves respect. He reveals not only a softer, more caring side to the species, but also finds evidence that a carcass was deliberately poisoned and laid out for the raptors to feed on, resulting in numerous deaths

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Second of two compilations of highlights from the 11th series of the quiz with a difference, hosted by Stephen Fry. Guests including David Mitchell, Ross Noble, Phill Jupitus, Katherine Ryan, Josh Widdicombe, Sue Perkins, Bill Bailey, Jimmy Carr and Jeremy Clarkson joined regular panellist Alan Davies to answer questions based on subjects beginning with the letter K. Last in the series

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Emily Maitlis

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Weather

programme.title: Live Davis Cup Tennis
programme.desc: USA v Great Britain. Continued coverage from BBC Three of day one of the first-round match from the World Group, held at Petco Park in San Diego, where the singles rubbers continue. This is Britain's first appearance in the elite group since 2008 and, fitness permitting, much of their hopes will rest on the form of Wimbledon champion Andy Murray. Commentary by Jonathan Overend and John Lloyd

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs a topical debate from Norwich, with panellists including Kenneth Clarke MP answering questions from the audience

programme.title: Michael Palin in Wyeth's World
programme.desc: Monty Python star Michael Palin heads to rural Pennsylvania and Maine to explore the life and work of Andrew Wyeth, one of America's most popular and controversial artists. He goes in search of the real-life stories that inspired Wyeth's depictions of the US landscape and its hard-working inhabitants, tracking down the farmers, friends and family featured in his paintings. He also chats to Helga Testorf, who secretly posed for Wyeth from 1971 to 1985

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Enchanted April (1935)
programme.desc: A woman trapped in a dull marriage tires of her daily routine and decides she needs some excitement. With three equally unfulfilled friends, she rents a villa in Italy for the month of April, and together they all try to work out what is missing from their lives. Romantic comedy drama, with Ann Harding and Frank Morgan

programme.title: The Maggie (1954)
programme.desc: A brash American businessman hires a small Scottish company to move a set of valuable furniture to his new home on a remote island. However, he soon learns that his belongings are to be transported on a dilapidated boat in desperate need of repair - and sets out in hot pursuit of them. Ealing comedy, with Paul Douglas, Alex Mackenzie, James Copeland and Tommy Kearins

programme.title: Life on Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the history of reptiles and explores how they were the first back-boned creatures to solve the problems of becoming land-dwellers

programme.title: Life on Earth
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the life of birds, focusing on the uses and advantages of their feathers in flight and during courtship. Presented by David Attenborough

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Made in Britain
programme.desc: The former steeplejack fulfils a personal ambition by driving his traction engine across the Scammonden Bridge near Huddersfield, West Yorkshire. He also visits a forge in Sheffield and watches crucible steel being made by the experts at Abbeydale Industrial Hamlet

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In North Yorkshire, Michael Portillo goes bird-watching on the cliffs of Flamborough Head before travelling to Filey, where he learns to decipher traditional knitting patterns. He then continues his journey to the Victorian seaside resort of Scarborough, and views a 4,000-year-old skeleton called Gristhorpe Man

programme.title: The A to Z of TV Cooking
programme.desc: John Torode embarks on an alphabetical journey through dishes prepared by an array of TV chefs

programme.title: The Good Cook
programme.desc: Food writer Simon Hopkinson demonstrates how to create restaurant-quality food at home, preparing cheese and onion pie, Rockefeller-style mussels, Tuscan tomato and bread salad, tender breast of lamb with onions and orange caramel custard. He also discusses his love of sourdough bread

programme.title: The Big Bread Experiment
programme.desc: A year into the experiment the group's former leader Cath Vickers has been relocated farther south, but the group re-forms and forges ahead with its plans. The mill is now producing flour, so the search begins for suitable premises and a new trainee before the bakery's launch, but there are questions about whether Bedale will take the project to its heart. Last in the series

programme.title: Anchors Aweigh (1945)
programme.desc: Joseph and Clarence are sailors on shore leave in Hollywood, where they hope to meet a bevy of starlets. Instead, they encounter Susan, a bit-part actress and singer desperate for an audition with a famous musician. When Joseph manages to arrange it for her, she repays him with romantic overtures, while Clarence only has eyes for a Brooklyn girl. Musical, with Gene Kelly, Frank Sinatra and Kathryn Grayson. Featuring the famous dance duet between Kelly and Jerry the cartoon mouse

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents a round-up of the classified results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, Football League and Scotland

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Nick Crane visits a project to build a new seaport for London, before travelling across the channel to Belgium, where he takes a ride on a tram that runs along the country's coastline. In Kent, Alice Roberts learns how to be a seaside landlady in Margate, Kent, and Neil Oliver tells the story of British forces' efforts to stop Hitler's biggest battleships reaching the south-eastern coastline during the Second World War. Back in Belgium, Mark Horton reveals the city of Bruges's role in the history of brick-making, and Miranda Krestovnikoff goes shrimp-fishing on horseback

programme.title: Vultures
programme.desc: Cameraman and naturalist Charlie Hamilton James travels to eastern Africa to try to show a different side to the much-maligned vulture, which he believes is a beautiful and intelligent bird that deserves respect. He reveals not only a softer, more caring side to the species, but also finds evidence that a carcass was deliberately poisoned and laid out for the raptors to feed on, resulting in numerous deaths

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Kate Bliss and David Fletcher travel to Warminster, Wiltshire, where they offer their opinions on people's antiques and collectibles before they go to auction. Paul Martin also investigates the UFO sightings reported in the town in the 1960s and 70s

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Captain Mainwaring and his platoon acquire a boat, planning to use it for coastal patrols, but after setting sail they get lost in fog. When the men finally reach dry land, they believe they have crossed the Channel and landed behind enemy lines. Vintage comedy first shown in 1969, starring Arthur Lowe

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry presents an extended version of the quiz, and unleashes a batch of fiendishly puzzling questions to test the general knowledge - or ignorance - of Jo Brand, Liza Tarbuck, Sue Perkins and regular panellist Alan Davies, who reveal what they know about topics including jelly, jam and juice

programme.title: Made in Dagenham (2010)
programme.desc: The female employees making upholstery for a 1960s British car firm campaign for the right to equal pay, only for the company to declare their work is `unskilled'. The women embark on a national protest, taking their grievance all the way to the government and demanding a change in the law. Fact-based comedy drama, starring Sally Hawkins, Miranda Richardson and Bob Hoskins

programme.title: Live Davis Cup Tennis
programme.desc: USA v Great Britain. Continued coverage from BBC Three of day two of the first-round match from the World Group, held at Petco Park in San Diego, where the doubles rubber takes place. Britain's last fixture was in September when Colin Fleming and Andy Murray won their doubles match against Croatia, but whichever duo are on court for the British this time are likely to face the daunting presence of Bob and Mike Bryan across the net. Commentary by Jonathan Overend and John Lloyd. Subsequent programmes subject to change

programme.title: Daybreak
programme.desc: Comedian, actress and author Arabella Weir talks about her guest role in tonight's episode of Midsomer Murders. Plus, news and current affairs, and the usual mix of health, entertainment and lifestyle features. Presented by Matt Barbet, Ranvir Singh, Lorraine Kelly and Aled Jones

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Kristin Scott Thomas talks about her role in new film The Invisible Woman, which reunites her with her English Patient co-star Ralph Fiennes. Plus, entertainment and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories, cooking and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly

programme.title: The Jeremy Kyle Show
programme.desc: The host invites guests to air their differences over family and relationship issues, and provides them with his own brand of no-nonsense advice

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Celebrity chat and lifestyle features, including a look at the stories making the newspaper headlines, viewers' comments in the Hub and a recipe in the kitchen. Presented by Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby. Including at 11.25 ITV News and Regional Weather

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Ruth Langsford, Jamelia and Janet Street-Porter are joined by singer Michael Bolton as they present another helping of topical studio discussion from a female perspective

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: News

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson visits Caernarfon, north Wales, where Michael Hogben is accused of being stingy by an unhappy lady, and Karen Dalmeny deals with a feisty girl with a sword. In the auction room, there's a shock in store when an item goes under the hammer and raises an extraordinary amount of money

programme.title: The Alan Titchmarsh Show
programme.desc: Midsomer Murders actor Neil Dudgeon and Waterloo Road's Zoe Lucker join the host for another helping of topical discussion and music

programme.title: ITV London Weather
programme.desc: Weather

programme.title: Britain's Best Bakery
programme.desc: Mich Turner and Peter Sidwell challenge two cake-making mothers from Perthshire, a French-style Edinburgh boulangerie and a team of traditional family bakers to create a product that combines pistachio and meringue. They are then asked to prepare Arbroath smokie tarts side by side in the same kitchen

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: Party Political Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Labour Party

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Val receives a visit from Victoria, who is furious to hear she and Eric have broken up over an affair. Will Val reveal her secret? Pete is cagey when Ross finds wads of cash in his brother's pocket and knows something is going on, while Declan and Charity put on a romantic display for everyone to see

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Roy remains inscrutable as the celebrant visits to discuss the funeral, but Fiz is worried when he finally erupts and bemoans how everything has to be how Hayley wanted. Stella is impressed as Dev and Kal work on their business plan for the gym, while Maddie admits to Sophie she needs money to help her little brother. Kylie tells Nick to stop feeling sorry for himself, and Beth gets her job back

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When wealthy farmer Martin Strickland is discovered bound to a tree, doused in truffle oil and mauled to death by a wild boar, the investigation leads DCI Barnaby to tyrannical celebrity chef Ruth Cameron at the upmarket Wyvern House restaurant. However, secrets from the past surface after the murderer strikes again, and the repercussions are felt further than they were originally intended. With Neil Dudgeon, Neil McCaul, Sharon Small, Marc Elliott and Arabella Weir

programme.title: ITV News at Ten and Weather
programme.desc: News

programme.title: ITV News London
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host chats to actors Robert Lindsay and Rufus Hound, who are about to star together in Dirty Rotten Scoundrels in the West End, and stand-up comedian Seann Walsh. Also on the sofa are chart-topping rapper Tinie Tempah and X Factor winner Sam Bailey, both of whom also perform in the studio

programme.title: Corfu

programme.title: The Lying Game
programme.desc: Forensic psychologists and behavioural experts examine some of the notorious criminal cases from the past 20 years in which the perpetrators appeared in front of the cameras with fake displays of grief. Aiming to show how such lies can be exposed through scientific methods, they look at the murders committed by Ian Huntley, Stuart Hazell and Mitchell Quy, Karen Matthews' plot to kidnap her own child, and Fadi Nasri, who hired a hitman to kill his wife. Narrated by Lesley Sharp

programme.title: Strictly Kosher
programme.desc: Conclusion. Bernette Clarke talks about the Jewish mourning period following the death of her mother-in-law, explaining why her husband Michael will not be able to take part in any festivals or enjoy himself for a year. Joel Lever takes a trip to Paris to stock up on the latest fashions for his boutique, while Rabbi Zevi Saunders visits a wedding fair in preparation for his big day. Jack Aizenberg explores the site of the concentration camp in which he was held, before returning to Manchester for a moving bar mitzvah with his family

programme.desc: A security guard catches Brenda red-handed as she tries to steal another portable music player, and the cafe incident continues with Bob wrongly accusing Ruby of taking the customer's purse. programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Roy tells Carla he is boycotting the funeral, but she orders him to get dressed and they join the other mourners at the ceremony. However, after Fiz speaks to the congregation about her memories of Hayley, he feels he can't remain silent anymore. Steve improvises a spread at the Rovers when the caterers fail to deliver the food for the wake, and Andrea drops by to lend a hand. Leanne suggests Nick move back into Victoria Court while she and Simon stay with Stella, and during a visit to the shelter, Sophie is alarmed to see that Maddie's face is bruised. Rob is annoyed when Tracy shuns his offer of a night out to spend time with Amy

programme.title: The Martin Lewis Money Show

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Roy feels besieged by well-wishers at the wake and escapes the barrage of sympathy. Spotting his absence, Anna and Fiz call at the cafe and find he has left them a note. Sophie tells Steph that Maddie kissed her, and Tracy is taken aback when Rob asks to join her cosy night in with Amy

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: The actor and musician joins the host to look back over his life and career. Martin, who found fame as the bassist in Spandau Ballet, before going on to star in EastEnders and The Krays, tells of the brain tumours that nearly killed him and reveals that George Michael helped him find a wife, as well as land his TV soap role. He also opens up about the deaths of his parents within days of each other, and how this prompted his band to get back together

programme.desc: Members of staff at Australia Zoo prepare for the filming of Croc Live, part of Croc Week 2003. However, with the animals unsettled by the crew's arrival, rehearsals prove much more chaotic than the final broadcast, where stars taking part include Dame Edna Everage and children's musical group the Wiggles

programme.title: Charade (1963)
programme.desc: A distraught widow learns her husband was murdered for his part in a $250,000 robbery. The haul has gone missing, and his former accomplices are soon on her tail in the hunt for the missing proceeds. Not knowing where to turn, she takes up the offer of help from a dashing stranger, but is uncertain whether she can trust him. Romantic thriller, with Audrey Hepburn, Cary Grant, Walter Matthau and James Coburn

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Farmer Alex Preston is found dead at the sacred Crowcall stone circle in Midsomer Mow. Suspicion initially falls on local druids led by high priests Ezra Canning and Leticia Clifford, since Preston's plans to plough Gorse Meadow would have barred their access to the site. Barnaby and Jones are joined by new pathologist Kate Wilding to investigate, and as the case wears on, the inspector becomes convinced greed rather than spiritualism is the motive. Starring Neil Dudgeon, Jason Hughes and Tamzin Malleson

programme.title: Johnny English (2003)
programme.desc: A bumbling secret agent becomes Britain's leading spy following the assassination of all the country's other espionage experts. Single-handedly he sets out to unmask a mysterious villain responsible for stealing the Crown Jewels - but no one is prepared to believe a sinister billionaire is the culprit. Comedy, starring Rowan Atkinson, John Malkovich, Natalie Imbruglia and Ben Miller

Mentored by Olympic bronze medallist Tom Daley, they're aiming to impress the judges and the voting public to win a place in the final, but two of them will have to battle it out in the Splash Off. Vernon Kay and Gabby Logan present

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: The love lift delivers a Manchester football coach, a Surrey student, a carpet cleaner from Glasgow and a plumber from Bognor Regis, all of whom are hoping to land a date with one of 30 single women on the Isle of Fernandos. However, to have any chance of succeeding, they must ensure the female participants keep their lights on as a sign of approval. But in the final round, if only one or two remain lit, they will have the choice of opting for the mystery girl, based solely on the sound of her voice. Paddy McGuinness presents

programme.title: Children on the Frontline
programme.desc: More than 11,000 children have been killed in Syria's ongoing civil war and over a million are now refugees. The country's largest city, Aleppo, has become engulfed by fighting between pro- and anti-regime groups. Schools have shut, food is in short supply and there is the constant threat of shelling, sniper fire and kidnap. This Dispatches documentary tells the stories of five youngsters whose lives have been changed for ever by the conflict - siblings Helen, Farah, Sara and Mohammed, whose father is a rebel commander, and Aboude, a singer and poster boy for the Syrian uprising. Narrated by James D'Arcy

The country's largest city, Aleppo, has become engulfed by fighting between pro- and anti-regime groups. Schools have shut, food is in short supply and there is the constant threat of shelling, sniper fire and kidnap. This Dispatches documentary tells the stories of five youngsters whose lives have been changed for ever by the conflict - siblings Helen, Farah, Sara and Mohammed, whose father is a rebel commander, and Aboude, a singer and poster boy for the Syrian uprising. Narrated by James D'Arcy

programme.title: Winter Road Rescue
programme.desc: As torrential rain in the south-west of England brings some of the worst flooding in living memory, the RAC's Ian Devonshire and Sean Kimberlin are on high alert as they come to the rescue of stranded motorists. In the Highlands, plough driver Stevie Booth faces a new route and a race against time to get the roads clear of snow and ice. Across the UK, as freezing temperatures follow the rain, the roads become treacherous and RAC patrolman Joe Ryan-Howes comes to the aid of a driver whose vehicle has skidded on sheet ice into a fence

programme.title: World's Worst Holiday Horrors
programme.desc: Ten tales of holiday-makers whose trips ended in disaster, featuring testimonies from the tourists themselves as well as video footage of the incidents. Including a man whose feet came out of the harness during a bungee jump 164ft above a lagoon in Thailand, a honeymooning couple on board the Costa Concordia cruise liner when she came to grief off the Italian coast in 2012, and the terrifying experience of a skier in Alaska

programme.title: The Truth About Your Dog's Food
programme.desc: Documentary examining the workings of the dog-food industry, revealing what goes into the meals during the manufacturing process. The film offers a comprehensive pet-owner's guide to feeding man's best friend, from vegan and all-meat diets to treats that may be bad or even harmful to canines

programme.title: Kids Who Kill
programme.desc: Documentary examining the personalities of children who have been convicted of murder and analysing what motivated them to kill. Daniel Bartlam was 14 when he attacked his mother Jacqueline with a claw hammer and set her body on fire, while Santre Sanchez Gayle was just 15 when he was paid Â£200 to kill Gulistan Subasi in 2010. Other cases featured include that of brothers Connor and Brandon Doran and their 14-year-old friend Simon Evans, who kicked a homeless man to death for a dare, as well as Robert Thompson and Jon Venables who were 10 when they killed toddler James Bulger in 1993

programme.title: CSI

Evidence leads Mac and the team to arsonist Leonard Brooks, who has just been released from prison after serving 15 years. Rob Morrow (Numb3rs) guest stars, with Gary Sinise

programme.title: Building the London Underground
programme.desc: One-off documentary charting four of the main technological advances that have helped make the Tube the second-biggest metro system in the world, including tunnel-boring methods developed in the 1880s and a new form of train propulsion invented for the New York City Subway. The programme also reveals how the Tube owes a debt to the engineers at the Paris Metro for their subterranean station designs, and the safety precautions that are in place to protect passengers in the event of a fire

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: New series. The return of the documentary following drivers transporting essential supplies to some of the remotest parts of North America. Alex Debogorski gets his first taste of Canada's Dempster Highway as he transports food from White Horse, Yukon, to Inuvik in the Northwest Territories, while Hugh Rowland answers the call when Polar Industries in Manitoba sends out a plea for truckers prepared to take on the slush and thin ice

programme.title: Ben Fogle
programme.desc: New series. The return of the programme in which Ben Fogle meets people who have moved to inhospitable parts of the world after leaving the rat race behind. He begins by travelling to the swamplands of southern Georgia in America to spend time with 64-year-old Colbert, a former financier who now lives in his hand-built wooden cabin. Ben learns some of the vital skills needed to survive in this dangerous backwater, including skinning roadkill, spearing frogs and drinking swamp water

programme.title: The Siege (1998)
