Determined that his co-star should be a complete unknown, he persuades the studio to hire a beguiling woman from the suburbs - unaware she is a genuine witch. Romantic fantasy comedy, with Nicole Kidman, Will Ferrell, Shirley MacLaine and Michael Caine

programme.title: Blue Streak (1999)
programme.desc: A convicted jewel thief is released from prison, and sets about recovering his hidden loot - only to discover a police station has since been built where he left it. Undeterred, he poses as a maverick cop and worms his way into the detective division - little realising his problems have only just begun. Comedy, starring Martin Lawrence, Luke Wilson and Peter Greene. Edited for language and violence

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: A harassed international singing star is stalked by a sinister character, giving Dr Sloan the opportunity to unravel a mystery. Medical drama, starring Dick Van Dyke and Scott Baio. Part of the Murder Mysteries strand

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A TV executive's assistant responds to being denied a promotion by killing her boss, then uses her years of experience working on detective shows to create the perfect cover-up. But she reckons without the intervention of Columbo, who begins laying his trap for her while also nursing a neck injury. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk and Trish Van Devere. Part of the Murder Mysteries strand. Edited for violence

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A Californian police commissioner helps a rich, influential friend to conceal his complicity in a murder - but reckons without detective Columbo's timely intervention and his dogged determination to catch the crooks. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Two FBI agents try to seize control of the team's investigation into the discovery of a perfectly preserved body hidden in a chimney at a Marine base. Meanwhile, McGee's literary efforts lead to discord with the others

programme.title: Winter Road Rescue
programme.desc: As torrential rain in the south-west of England brings some of the worst flooding in living memory, the RAC's Ian Devonshire and Sean Kimberlin are on high alert as they come to the rescue of stranded motorists. In the Highlands, plough driver Stevie Booth faces a new route and a race against time to get the roads clear of snow and ice. Across the UK, as freezing temperatures follow the rain, the roads become treacherous and RAC patrolman Joe Ryan-Howes comes to the aid of a driver whose vehicle has skidded on sheet ice into a fence

programme.title: World's Worst Holiday Horrors
programme.desc: Ten tales of holiday-makers whose trips ended in disaster, featuring testimonies from the tourists themselves as well as video footage of the incidents. Including a man whose feet came out of the harness during a bungee jump 164ft above a lagoon in Thailand, a honeymooning couple on board the Costa Concordia cruise liner when she came to grief off the Italian coast in 2012, and the terrifying experience of a skier in Alaska

programme.title: The Truth About Your Dog's Food
programme.desc: Documentary examining the workings of the dog-food industry, revealing what goes into the meals during the manufacturing process. The film offers a comprehensive pet-owner's guide to feeding man's best friend, from vegan and all-meat diets to treats that may be bad or even harmful to canines

programme.title: Kids Who Kill
programme.desc: Documentary examining the personalities of children who have been convicted of murder and analysing what motivated them to kill. Daniel Bartlam was 14 when he attacked his mother Jacqueline with a claw hammer and set her body on fire, while Santre Sanchez Gayle was just 15 when he was paid Â£200 to kill Gulistan Subasi in 2010. Other cases featured include that of brothers Connor and Brandon Doran and their 14-year-old friend Simon Evans, who kicked a homeless man to death for a dare, as well as Robert Thompson and Jon Venables who were 10 when they killed toddler James Bulger in 1993

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: The return of the crime drama. The fire department and the police are celebrating Mac's recovery at an ice-hockey game when both services are called away to deal with a blaze, which triggers an explosion that kills one of those attending the scene. Evidence leads Mac and the team to arsonist Leonard Brooks, who has just been released from prison after serving 15 years. Rob Morrow (Numb3rs) guest stars, with Gary Sinise

programme.title: Building the London Underground
programme.desc: One-off documentary charting four of the main technological advances that have helped make the Tube the second-biggest metro system in the world, including tunnel-boring methods developed in the 1880s and a new form of train propulsion invented for the New York City Subway. The programme also reveals how the Tube owes a debt to the engineers at the Paris Metro for their subterranean station designs, and the safety precautions that are in place to protect passengers in the event of a fire

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: New series. The return of the documentary following drivers transporting essential supplies to some of the remotest parts of North America. Alex Debogorski gets his first taste of Canada's Dempster Highway as he transports food from White Horse, Yukon, to Inuvik in the Northwest Territories, while Hugh Rowland answers the call when Polar Industries in Manitoba sends out a plea for truckers prepared to take on the slush and thin ice

programme.title: Ben Fogle
programme.desc: New series. The return of the programme in which Ben Fogle meets people who have moved to inhospitable parts of the world after leaving the rat race behind. He begins by travelling to the swamplands of southern Georgia in America to spend time with 64-year-old Colbert, a former financier who now lives in his hand-built wooden cabin. Ben learns some of the vital skills needed to survive in this dangerous backwater, including skinning roadkill, spearing frogs and drinking swamp water

programme.title: The Siege (1998)
programme.desc: New York is placed under martial law after a series of bombings and hijackings involving hundreds of casualties causes widespread panic, prompting a desperate bid by the FBI to find the terrorist cell responsible before full-scale civil unrest takes hold of the city. Thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Bruce Willis, Annette Bening and Tony Shalhoub

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions

programme.title: Among the Apes
programme.desc: Primatologist Charlotte Uhlenbroek travels the globe to spend time with simians in their natural habitat. She begins in the Budongo forest in Uganda for a two-week encounter with a group of chimpanzees known as the Sonso community. Joined by local experts, she tries to find acceptance and get to know the chimps as they fight to survive in their ever-dwindling territory

programme.title: Highland Emergency
programme.desc: The Coastguard struggles in an attempt to reach an injured walker on the Isle of Skye. A Royal Navy crew races to save a motocross rider with a badly injured leg and then attends to a walker on Arran who has broken a leg and is at risk of hypothermia

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Property expert Ann Maurice offers advice to would-be sellers on optimising space and dispelling animal odours in the home in a bid to secure a quick sale

programme.title: Divine Designs
programme.desc: Dr Paul Binski chronicles the development of religious architecture during the 16th and 17th centuries. He contrasts the ornate splendour of the chapel at King's College, Cambridge, with the simplicity of post-Reformation churches

programme.title: Divine Designs
programme.desc: Dr Paul Binski chronicles the development of religious architecture during the 16th and 17th centuries. He contrasts the ornate splendour of the chapel at King's College, Cambridge, with the simplicity of post-Reformation churches

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Suzy and Peppa decide to work in a shop to be more like adults, but discover it is very tiring

programme.title: Roary the Racing Car
programme.desc: Plugger realises he cannot do everything by himself and sometimes needs friends

programme.title: Fifi and the Flowertots
programme.desc: Fifi is put in charge of Poppy's stall, but the job is harder than it looks

programme.title: Bubble Guppies
programme.desc: A cow named Butterscotch and her farmer show the gang what life is like on a farm

programme.title: The Mr Men Show
programme.desc: Mr Fussy tries to keep down his food at Miss Magic's cafe, and Mr Grumpy has trouble ordering at Mr Tickle's restaurant

programme.title: Chloe's Closet
programme.desc: Chloe and the gang have fun helping a farmer keep the crows away from his crops by building a scarecrow

programme.title: Roobarb and Custard Too
programme.desc: As there is no news, Roobarb decides to become a media baron and make some of his own

programme.title: Bananas in Pyjamas
programme.desc: Morgan is desperate to grow up, but when the Bananas need help to rescue a small bird, he realises that being little is not so bad

programme.title: Make Way for Noddy
programme.desc: Dinah Doll takes Tessie Bear on a voyage of discovery and adventure

programme.title: Bert and Ernie's Great Adventures
programme.desc: The duo climb inside a computer to chase a virus

programme.title: City of Friends
programme.desc: Timba gets stuck down a drain and his screams for help make Kimmy nervous

programme.title: Little Princess
programme.desc: The youngster realises the importance of not wasting things and tries to think of ways to recycle rubbish

programme.title: The Adventures of Bottle Top Bill and His Best Friend Corky
programme.desc: The duo discover the Great Wild Woolly trapped under a stack of hay bales

programme.title: Angelina Ballerina
programme.desc: Viki wants to perform a dragon dance for a school assignment - but her friends are too busy to listen to her

programme.title: Rupert Bear
programme.desc: Ping Pong uses magic to clean up a book, bringing to life an octopus from its pages

programme.title: Ben and Holly's Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Captain Squid leaves a treasure map in the Little Kingdom, so Redbeard leads Ben, Holly and Nanny Plum on a search for the valuable item, which is located deep underwater

programme.title: Jelly Jamm
programme.desc: The Queen kicks the King out of the castle because of his unusual sleeping habits

programme.title: LazyTown
programme.desc: Stingy asks Sportacus to donate his crystal to the town's new museum so they will have something priceless to display, but once Robbie finds out, he decides to steal it

programme.title: Bewitched (2005)
programme.desc: A Hollywood has-been actor signs up to appear in a remake of the popular 1960s sitcom about a housewife with magical powers. Determined that his co-star should be a complete unknown, he persuades the studio to hire a beguiling woman from the suburbs - unaware she is a genuine witch. Romantic fantasy comedy, with Nicole Kidman, Will Ferrell, Shirley MacLaine and Michael Caine

programme.title: Blue Streak (1999)
programme.desc: A convicted jewel thief is released from prison, and sets about recovering his hidden loot - only to discover a police station has since been built where he left it. Undeterred, he poses as a maverick cop and worms his way into the detective division - little realising his problems have only just begun. Comedy, starring Martin Lawrence, Luke Wilson and Peter Greene. Edited for language and violence

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: A harassed international singing star is stalked by a sinister character, giving Dr Sloan the opportunity to unravel a mystery. Medical drama, starring Dick Van Dyke and Scott Baio

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A TV executive's assistant responds to being denied a promotion by killing her boss, then uses her years of experience working on detective shows to create the perfect cover-up. But she reckons without the intervention of Columbo, who begins laying his trap for her while also nursing a neck injury. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk and Trish Van Devere. Part of the Murder Mysteries strand. Edited for violence

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: A Californian police commissioner helps a rich, influential friend to conceal his complicity in a murder - but reckons without detective Columbo's timely intervention and his dogged determination to catch the crooks. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Richard Kiley and Rosemary Murphy

programme.title: 5 News Weekend
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: McGee tries to help his sister, who believes she may have murdered someone - but is too traumatised and disorientated to remember exactly what happened. As the team investigates the connected case of a sailor's death, Tony and Abby find themselves distracted by relationship problems. Drama, starring Sean Murray, Michael Weatherly and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Two FBI agents try to seize control of the team's investigation into the discovery of a perfectly preserved body hidden in a chimney at a Marine base. Reluctant to be ousted from the case, Gibbs agrees to work with them - and learns the victim was a serial killer responsible for the deaths of 14 people. Meanwhile, McGee's literary efforts lead to discord with the others

programme.title: The NCIS Movie
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A military aircraft transporting the bodies of US marines back home crashes before reaching its destination, and Gibbs and the team are called in to help identify human remains at the site of the wreckage. However, a DNA discrepancy turns a routine investigation into a search for a missing person. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon

programme.title: The Contract (2006)
programme.desc: Former cop Ray Keene takes his teenage son on a hiking trip in the woods, where they stumble across a hitman who has avoided capture by the FBI. Ray is determined to take the assassin back to where he can be brought to justice, but reckons without his prisoner's henchmen coming to set him free. Thriller, starring John Cusack, Morgan Freeman and Jamie Anderson. Edited to remove product placement

American sci-fi drama, guest starring Jason Dohring and Sarah Clarke, with Robbie Amell, Luke Mitchell and Peyton List

To humiliate the charming womaniser, his ex-girlfriends hatch a plan to set him up with a socially inept newcomer to the school, instructing her to break his heart. However, the plot founders as romance starts to blossom. Comedy, with Jesse Metcalfe, Brittany Snow, Ashanti and Sophia Bush

programme.title: Rude Tube

Comedy, starring Sandra Bullock, Michael Caine, Benjamin Bratt, Candice Bergen and William Shatner

His search leads him to the head of an ecological corporation, who is plotting to orchestrate a coup in a Latin American country to get his hands on a precious natural resource. Spy thriller sequel, starring Daniel Craig, Olga Kurylenko, Judi Dench, Gemma Arterton and Mathieu Amalric

programme.desc: The plight of two young girls is brought to the attention of Carol, who discovers them home alone. Joe confronts their parents who are out drinking, but finds stepfather Brian unremorseful and reluctant to leave the pub. programme.desc: A 1930s test pilot is devastated when his sweetheart is left in a coma. Unable to cope with waiting to see if she wakes up, he volunteers to be a subject for a cryonics experiment. But he ends up being on ice for 50 years, until two boys discover him. The youngsters' mother helps him adjust to the strange new world he has found himself in - and romance soon blossoms. Romantic sci-fi drama, with Mel Gibson, Jamie Lee Curtis, Elijah Wood and George Wendt. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.desc: Part one of two. Frustrated that a number of cases have been knocked back by the Crown Prosecution Service, Banks and the team are called on to investigate the murder of teenager Ellie Clayton, daughter of a high-profile internet entrepreneur. The victim's background, together with the suggestion she may have been raped, means the incident is soon the subject of much media speculation, and strong evidence implicates a theatre director who ran a drama workshop the girl attended on the night she died. The detective believes he has found his man, but Morton fears her colleague isn't seeing the bigger picture

programme.desc: Investigations into the identity of the victim of a car crash uncovers connections to violent criminals, and leads to worries about his intended business in Aidensfield. Not realising their true value, Peggy tries to offload some goats when she finds them too difficult to milk. Oscar takes on the surveillance of a woman whose husband suspects she is having an affair, leaving Dawn and Bernie in charge of the bar. Mark Moraghan and Adam Christopher guest star

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Frankie accidentally injures a man attempting to steal his motorbike, but is stricken with guilt when the thief dies after crashing the vehicle. A woman being treated for severe burns disappears home, where Drs Ormerod and Weatherill discover her family secret, while Alun becomes obsessed by an expensive stereo system. With Scott Taylor, Robert Daws and Amy Robbins

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Part one of two. While holidaying in Cornwall with his friend Captain Hastings, Poirot meets a local woman who has seemingly become unaccountably accident-prone - but soon starts to suspect she is actually a victim of foul play. David Suchet and Hugh Fraser star

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica tries to prove the innocence of a record producer suspected of murdering the man responsible for his blindness. Angela Lansbury stars as the super sleuth

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: An interpreter claims to have been abducted by two villains who forced him to interrogate a badly bruised and obviously distressed Greek captive unable to speak English. Period detective drama, starring Jeremy Brett

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Rachel's informant leads police to a drugs shipment at a deserted cove. The perpetrator's girlfriend, having struck up a friendship with Gina at antenatal classes, agrees to use her to help him escape - but a hostage crisis ensues, leaving the barmaid in great danger. Peggy comes up with alternative transport when Bernie worries his hearse won't be ready for a funeral. Tim Brooke-Taylor makes a guest appearance

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Adam is quick to question Dr Weatherill's competence when a beach outing ends tragically for a family. Dr Ormerod leaps in to defend her - but ends up revealing his colleague's condition in his haste. Meanwhile, Dr Goodwin struggles to help a pair of teenage parents gain access to their baby. Amy Robbins and Robert Daws star

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Belgian sleuth's Cornish holiday comes to a dramatic conclusion as he unravels the mystery behind the series of disastrous near-misses that placed the life of a beautiful heiress in danger, and as the truth comes to light, a secret engagement is revealed. David Suchet stars, with Philip Jackson and Hugh Fraser

programme.title: Fresh Fields
programme.desc: Hester is frustrated by William's snoring, and a neighbour's pet adds to her problems. Comedy, guest starring Stephanie Cole, with Anton Rodgers and Julia McKenzie

programme.title: Duty Free
programme.desc: Returning from Tangiers on a boat trip, Amy is given a mysterious box apparently containing a man's ashes to spread on Spanish soil. Comedy, starring Gwen Taylor and Keith Barron

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: An old flame of Mildred's turns up at the Roper house, prompting George to blow the cobwebs off his little black book. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Rachel's informant leads police to a drugs shipment at a deserted cove. The perpetrator's girlfriend, having struck up a friendship with Gina at antenatal classes, agrees to use her to help him escape - but a hostage crisis ensues, leaving the barmaid in great danger. Peggy comes up with alternative transport when Bernie worries his hearse won't be ready for a funeral. Tim Brooke-Taylor makes a guest appearance

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica visits Paris, where she investigates the death of an underworld loan shark involved in the world of high fashion. Whodunit, starring Angela Lansbury, alongside Juliet Prowse and Barbara Rush

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: A woman's body is pulled from the river, reminding Frost that he investigated the death of her husband's first wife years ago. Unfortunately, it turns out that a key witness's statement went astray during the earlier case - which leads to Frost being suspended from duty. Discreetly continuing his inquiries, he is intrigued to learn the local priest recently heard a very disturbing confession. Starring David Jason, Eoin McCarthy, Anthony Calf, Kenneth Cope and Isla Blair

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.desc: Part two of two. The collapse of Owen Pierce's trial has left the case wide open and there's still a killer on the loose, but Banks remains determined to build a watertight legal case against his prime suspect. As the investigation continues, Morton and Jackman uncover promising new leads focusing on Ellie's ex-boyfriend Tyler, but just as they seem to be getting close to the truth, another schoolgirl is murdered, putting Pierce in the spotlight once again

programme.title: The Vice
programme.desc: Chappel gets dangerously involved with a prostitute and tries to save her from the clutches of a financier whom he suspects of committing several recent murders in the financial heart of London. Drama, starring Ken Stott

programme.title: Forever Young (1992)
programme.desc: A 1930s test pilot is devastated when his sweetheart is left in a coma. Unable to cope with waiting to see if she wakes up, he volunteers to be a subject for a cryonics experiment. But he ends up being on ice for 50 years, until two boys discover him. The youngsters' mother helps him adjust to the strange new world he has found himself in - and romance soon blossoms. Romantic sci-fi drama, with Mel Gibson, Jamie Lee Curtis, Elijah Wood and George Wendt. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica visits Paris, where she investigates the death of an underworld loan shark involved in the world of high fashion. Whodunit, starring Angela Lansbury, alongside Juliet Prowse and Barbara Rush

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A solicitor enlists Holmes to help clear him of murdering eccentric builder Jonas Oldacre, whose considerable personal fortune he stood to inherit. Drama, starring Jeremy Brett as the famed Victorian detective

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Geoff fails to control of a violent outbreak at the bookmakers, and is in awe of Joe as he takes command of the situation. Debt collector Mick Revill (guest star Martin Kemp) suggests a way to toughen him up, but elsewhere Revill is accused by a local businessman of being involved in some dubious deals. Meanwhile, Peggy can't understand David's reluctance to attend a centenary party at the school

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Mr Rose and Dr Ormerod attempt to rescue a drowning boy during a trip to a hippie commune. Catherine is asked on a date by a local fisherman, while Dr Goodwin discovers the parents of a sick baby are not all they seem after he diagnoses the infant's illness. Robert Daws, Denis Lill, Amelia Curtis and Paul Fox star

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective is summoned to a hotel by a mysterious veiled lady who tells him that her forthcoming marriage is under threat because she is being blackmailed over a love letter. Drama, starring David Suchet and Frances Barber

programme.title: Fresh Fields
programme.desc: Hester decides the community needs an old folks' home, and takes her fight to the local council. Comedy, starring Julia McKenzie

programme.title: Duty Free
programme.desc: One of David's obnoxious former schoolfriends turns up at the hotel and soon puts a spanner in the works by taking a photo of him kissing Linda. Roger Sloman guest-stars in the sitcom, with Keith Barron, Joanna Van Gyseghem and Gwen Taylor

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: Poor Mildred's hopes are raised when work-shy George looks for a job, but his chances of finding gainful employment seem slim. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Geoff fails to control of a violent outbreak at the bookmakers, and is in awe of Joe as he takes command of the situation. Debt collector Mick Revill (guest star Martin Kemp) suggests a way to toughen him up, but elsewhere Revill is accused by a local businessman of being involved in some dubious deals. Meanwhile, Peggy can't understand David's reluctance to attend a centenary party at the school

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica investigates an old murder case involving close friends and former students in her home town of Cabot Cove. Crime drama, starring Angela Lansbury, Tom Bosley and Dack Rambo

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective's curiosity is aroused by the passengers on board a luxury cruise ship bound for Egypt - particularly a woman who appears inordinately offensive to her fellow travellers. When the vessel arrives at Alexandria, the irritating lady's body is discovered in her cabin - leaving the sleuth with a host of possible suspects to interrogate. David Suchet stars

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: Having booked a room in a posh London hotel for a night of passion, William discovers that romance is not as easy as it seems, until Mary makes a seductive suggestion. There's a nasty shock in store for two new parents, and Mary is called to help - leading to serious repercussions at work - while a couple of William's clients have an unusual request for their father's send-off

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Janet moves a step closer to tracking down Veronica's killer while investigating a recent murder that bears similarities to the cold case. Rachel finds out about an affair Nick once had with a juror in the middle of a trial - a revelation that could end his career. Detective drama, starring Lesley Sharp, Suranne Jones and Rupert Graves

programme.title: The Vice
programme.desc: A retired prostitute (Denise Welch) gives Chappel a lead in his quest to prove legitimate businessman Keith Beaumont is still operating in London's vice underworld. Infected by her boss's obsessive enthusiasm for the task, Kirsty offers herself as bait in a honeytrap that could place her in great danger and leave Joe with a major moral dilemma. Drama, starring Ken Stott and Rosie Marcel

programme.title: Intolerable Cruelty (2003)
programme.desc: A serial gold-digger plans her revenge on the flashy lawyer who stopped her coining a fortune out of her most recent husband, and as she turns on the charm, he struggles to come up with a counter-con. Coen brothers comedy, starring George Clooney, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Geoffrey Rush, Cedric the Entertainer and Edward Herrmann. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin

programme.title: Judge Judy
programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin

programme.desc: Text-based information service

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Soap/Melodrama/Folkloric

programme.title: Movies Now
programme.desc: News, reviews and interviews with the stars

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: An interpreter claims to have been abducted by two villains who forced him to interrogate a badly bruised and obviously distressed Greek captive unable to speak English. Period detective drama, starring Jeremy Brett

programme.title: Life with Judy Garland
programme.desc: Part one of two. Judy Davis stars as the legendary Hollywood actress, who shot to fame as Dorothy in The Wizard of Oz, in this drama based on the memoirs of her youngest daughter Lorna Luft. Focusing on her relationships and dependency on drugs and alcohol, With Hugh Laurie and Victor Garber as her husbands Vincente Minnelli and Sid Luft and Tammy Blanchard as the young Judy

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: The slovenly sleuth sets out on a pleasure cruise to Acapulco. However, one of the passengers is planning to kill his lover to stop her blackmailing him, and has arranged a cast-iron alibi. But when the crime is discovered, the captain looks to Columbo to solve the mystery. Drama, starring Peter Falk, Robert Vaughn, Dean Stockwell, Patrick Macnee and Poupee Bocar

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: An unusual message appears in Chipping Cleghorn's local newspaper, revealing details of a forthcoming murder and, while at first glance it looks like a practical joke, the information proves to be deadly accurate. Miss Marple helps Inspector Craddock with his investigation and the pair soon uncover several likely suspects in the village. Starring Geraldine McEwan, with Zoe Wanamaker, Elaine Paige, Virginia McKenna, Cherie Lunghi and Frances Barber

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective's curiosity is aroused by the passengers on board a luxury cruise ship bound for Egypt - particularly a woman who appears inordinately offensive to her fellow travellers. When the vessel arrives at Alexandria, the irritating lady's body is discovered in her cabin - leaving the sleuth with a host of possible suspects to interrogate. David Suchet stars

programme.title: Summer Holiday (1963)
programme.desc: Four mechanics embark on a fun-filled trip across Europe on board a double-decker London bus, and enjoy all manner of romantic adventures with three young women who hitch a ride on their way to Athens. However, an unexpected stowaway leads to a few surprises. Musical comedy, starring Cliff Richard, Lauri Peters, Melvyn Hayes, Una Stubbs, Ron Moody and the Shadows. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: A rehearsal of an amateur operatic production ends with Morse being arrested on suspicion of murder and suspended from duty pending further investigation. Stripped of official powers, he fights to clear his name - unaware he has been pencilled in as the real killer's next target. Guest starring Ian McDiarmid, with John Thaw and Kevin Whately

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are asked to restore an ornate water garden cascade in the grounds of a health spa, where they are invited to join owner Frances Caldecott and her children for dinner. That evening, the duo discover Frances has been strangled and her jewellery stolen, and set out to catch the culprit. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: New neighbours look set to disturb the tranquillity of Portwenn, upsetting the locals with their unconventional lifestyle and even managing to gatecrash an intimate dinner between Martin and Louisa. Meanwhile, a car vandal strikes the village - but agoraphobic village copper PC Penhale is too scared to leave the station and investigate. Martin Clunes stars

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective's former colleague, Sergeant Stuart Macken, is left badly burned when his house is petrol-bombed, while his teenage daughter fights for her life in intensive care. As Vera tries to discover why anyone would attempt to kill Stuart, her investigation leads to unpleasant revelations about his personal life, and she has to face long-buried memories of her own. Crime drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, with Steven Hartley (The Bill) and Julie Graham (William and Mary)

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Part two of two. DI Jack Frost sets out to untangle the circumstances surrounding fellow detective Tim Fox's death and get to the bottom of the pet killings in the vicinity of the power station before the sands of time run out. Starring David Jason, Bruce Alexander and Nicky Henson

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Fresh Fields
programme.desc: Hester makes plans to stand for election to the local residents' association and enlists William to help with her speech. However, she soon finds her success jeopardised by an attractive rival. Comedy, starring Anton Rodgers and Julia McKenzie

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The plight of two young girls is brought to the attention of Carol, who discovers them home alone. Joe confronts their parents who are out drinking, but finds stepfather Brian unremorseful and reluctant to leave the pub. Gina is distracted from her worries about her unborn baby by preparations for the imminent arrival of Phil's niece Dawn, but when David goes to meet the girl from the station she is nowhere to be seen. Nikki Sanderson joins the cast

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: The hospital has its hands full when a typhoid epidemic breaks out in the community. Things get worse as the disease's source is traced back to the wards and staff struggle to locate it. Dr Weatherill is forced to reprimand Dr Ormerod after catching him sleeping on the job - but also has startling news for him. Drama, starring Robert Daws and Amy Robbins

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: On doctor's orders, the dapper Belgian sleuth visits Brighton for what he hopes will be a relaxing holiday, but it leads to one of the most absorbing cases he has ever faced - the disappearance of a cache of jewels. Mystery, starring David Suchet, with Hermione Norris, Philip Jackson and Sorcha Cusack

programme.desc: Real-life small-claims cases on issues affecting family life, presided over by outspoken former New York judge Judy Sheindlin

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica researches a 30-year-old murder case that may have led to the imprisonment of an innocent man. Starring Angela Lansbury and Richard Beymer

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A governess takes up a new position, but feels constrained to consult Holmes about some of the bizarre conditions stipulated by her employer. Period crime drama, guest starring Natasha Richardson, Joss Ackland and Patience Collier, with Jeremy Brett and David Burke

programme.title: Duty Free
programme.desc: TV actor Frazer Hines books into the Spanish hotel and makes a play for Amy who, following some withering remarks from David, agrees to go on a date with him

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: The Ropers' bed collapses and George finds himself short of cash to acquire a new one. Comedy, starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.desc: Part one of two. Frustrated that a number of cases have been knocked back by the Crown Prosecution Service, Banks and the team are called on to investigate the murder of teenager Ellie Clayton, daughter of a high-profile internet entrepreneur. The victim's background, together with the suggestion she may have been raped, means the incident is soon the subject of much media speculation, and strong evidence implicates a theatre director who ran a drama workshop the girl attended on the night she died. The detective believes he has found his man, but Morton fears her colleague isn't seeing the bigger picture

programme.title: The Vice
programme.desc: Chappel hopes to resume his relationship with ex-girlfriend Jane despite her descent into prostitution, but his plans are threatened when bent copper DS Vickers crawls out of the woodwork. Determined to put his old enemy behind bars, Chappel soon finds himself facing the toughest decision of his career. Starring Ken Stott, Sarah Parish and Tim Pigott-Smith

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Part one of two. When the body of a high-class prostitute is found in an abandoned suitcase at Heathrow, the evidence leads to a Ukrainian billionaire who had availed himself of her services. Against all diplomatic advice and despite the woman's pimp also being implicated in the crime, Walker arrests Malikov - only to find himself a pawn in a much bigger game. Crime drama, with David Hayman

programme.title: Fresh Fields
programme.desc: Hester is frustrated by William's snoring, and a neighbour's pet adds to her problems. Comedy, guest starring Stephanie Cole, with Anton Rodgers and Julia McKenzie

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Rachel's informant leads police to a drugs shipment at a deserted cove. The perpetrator's girlfriend, having struck up a friendship with Gina at antenatal classes, agrees to use her to help him escape - but a hostage crisis ensues, leaving the barmaid in great danger. Peggy comes up with alternative transport when Bernie worries his hearse won't be ready for a funeral. Tim Brooke-Taylor makes a guest appearance

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Adam is quick to question Dr Weatherill's competence when a beach outing ends tragically for a family. Dr Ormerod leaps in to defend her - but ends up revealing his colleague's condition in his haste. Meanwhile, Dr Goodwin struggles to help a pair of teenage parents gain access to their baby. Amy Robbins and Robert Daws star

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Belgian sleuth's Cornish holiday comes to a dramatic conclusion as he unravels the mystery behind the series of disastrous near-misses that placed the life of a beautiful heiress in danger, and as the truth comes to light, a secret engagement is revealed. David Suchet stars, with Philip Jackson and Hugh Fraser

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes

Meanwhile, Peggy can't understand David's reluctance to attend a centenary party at the school

Robert Daws, Denis Lill, Amelia Curtis and Paul Fox star

programme.desc: The Belgian detective is summoned to a hotel by a mysterious veiled lady who tells him that her forthcoming marriage is under threat because she is being blackmailed over a love letter. Drama, starring David Suchet and Frances Barber

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective's curiosity is aroused by the passengers on board a luxury cruise ship bound for Egypt - particularly a woman who appears inordinately offensive to her fellow travellers. When the vessel arrives at Alexandria, the irritating lady's body is discovered in her cabin - leaving the sleuth with a host of possible suspects to interrogate. David Suchet stars

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: Having booked a room in a posh London hotel for a night of passion, William discovers that romance is not as easy as it seems, until Mary makes a seductive suggestion. There's a nasty shock in store for two new parents, and Mary is called to help - leading to serious repercussions at work - while a couple of William's clients have an unusual request for their father's send-off

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Janet moves a step closer to tracking down Veronica's killer while investigating a recent murder that bears similarities to the cold case. Rachel finds out about an affair Nick once had with a juror in the middle of a trial - a revelation that could end his career. Detective drama, starring Lesley Sharp, Suranne Jones and Rupert Graves

programme.title: The Vice
programme.desc: A retired prostitute (Denise Welch) gives Chappel a lead in his quest to prove legitimate businessman Keith Beaumont is still operating in London's vice underworld. Infected by her boss's obsessive enthusiasm for the task, Kirsty offers herself as bait in a honeytrap that could place her in great danger and leave Joe with a major moral dilemma. Drama, starring Ken Stott and Rosie Marcel

programme.title: Intolerable Cruelty (2003)
programme.desc: A serial gold-digger plans her revenge on the flashy lawyer who stopped her coining a fortune out of her most recent husband, and as she turns on the charm, he struggles to come up with a counter-con. programme.title: Life with Judy Garland
programme.desc: Part one of two. Judy Davis stars as the legendary Hollywood actress, who shot to fame as Dorothy in The Wizard of Oz, in this drama based on the memoirs of her youngest daughter Lorna Luft. Focusing on her relationships and dependency on drugs and alcohol, With Hugh Laurie and Victor Garber as her husbands Vincente Minnelli and Sid Luft and Tammy Blanchard as the young Judy

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: The slovenly sleuth sets out on a pleasure cruise to Acapulco. However, one of the passengers is planning to kill his lover to stop her blackmailing him, and has arranged a cast-iron alibi. But when the crime is discovered, the captain looks to Columbo to solve the mystery. Drama, starring Peter Falk, Robert Vaughn, Dean Stockwell, Patrick Macnee and Poupee Bocar

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: An unusual message appears in Chipping Cleghorn's local newspaper, revealing details of a forthcoming murder and, while at first glance it looks like a practical joke, the information proves to be deadly accurate. Miss Marple helps Inspector Craddock with his investigation and the pair soon uncover several likely suspects in the village. Starring Geraldine McEwan, with Zoe Wanamaker, Elaine Paige, Virginia McKenna, Cherie Lunghi and Frances Barber

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective's curiosity is aroused by the passengers on board a luxury cruise ship bound for Egypt - particularly a woman who appears inordinately offensive to her fellow travellers. programme.title: Summer Holiday (1963)
programme.desc: Four mechanics embark on a fun-filled trip across Europe on board a double-decker London bus, and enjoy all manner of romantic adventures with three young women who hitch a ride on their way to Athens. However, an unexpected stowaway leads to a few surprises. Musical comedy, starring Cliff Richard, Lauri Peters, Melvyn Hayes, Una Stubbs, Ron Moody and the Shadows

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: A rehearsal of an amateur operatic production ends with Morse being arrested on suspicion of murder and suspended from duty pending further investigation. Stripped of official powers, he fights to clear his name - unaware he has been pencilled in as the real killer's next target. Guest starring Ian McDiarmid, with John Thaw and Kevin Whately

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are asked to restore an ornate water garden cascade in the grounds of a health spa, where they are invited to join owner Frances Caldecott and her children for dinner. That evening, the duo discover Frances has been strangled and her jewellery stolen, and set out to catch the culprit. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: New neighbours look set to disturb the tranquillity of Portwenn, upsetting the locals with their unconventional lifestyle and even managing to gatecrash an intimate dinner between Martin and Louisa. Meanwhile, a car vandal strikes the village - but agoraphobic village copper PC Penhale is too scared to leave the station and investigate. Martin Clunes stars

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective's former colleague, Sergeant Stuart Macken, is left badly burned when his house is petrol-bombed, while his teenage daughter fights for her life in intensive care. As Vera tries to discover why anyone would attempt to kill Stuart, her investigation leads to unpleasant revelations about his personal life, and she has to face long-buried memories of her own. Crime drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, with Steven Hartley (The Bill) and Julie Graham (William and Mary)

Comedy sequel, starring Jim Carrey, Simon Callow and Bob Gunton

programme.title: American Idol
programme.desc: New series. Another set of would-be stars hope to follow in the footsteps of last season's winner Candice Glover as Ryan Seacrest returns with the successful singing competition. However, this year only Keith Urban will be returning to the judges panel, with Harry Connick Jr and Jennifer Lopez claiming the seats previously occupied by Mariah Carey, Nicki Minaj and Randy Jackson

programme.title: Top 20 Funniest
programme.desc: A countdown of some of the funniest video clips in America, featuring painful stunts around a back garden pool, animals that take a shine to female tourists and men who try pole-dancing. Plus, a son turns the tables on his father in the number one prank

programme.title: World's Worst Tenants
programme.desc: Ex-Marine Todd Howard, his wife Randye and business partner Rick Moore help landlords evict their most unruly and aggressive tenants. In the first edition, the team investigates reports of medical waste being dumped at an apartment building. Later, Todd risks his life when an occupant tries to make a run for it

programme.title: World's Worst Tenants
programme.desc: The team enters a hostile tenant's apartment, and discovers someone is practising taxidermy. Meanwhile, Rick Moore and Todd Howard help to mediate a violent domestic dispute in a pawnshop

programme.title: Top 20
programme.desc: Another selection of nail-biting close calls are showcased, including footage of panicking commuters who found themselves in the path of an oncoming train, a matador gored in the groin by an angry bull, and a bloody battle for survival against a grizzly bear at a zoo

programme.title: Falling Skies
programme.desc: Tom and Hal lead a team to gather more motorcycles for the 2nd Massachusetts after Pope provides details on where they can be found. Meanwhile, back at the school base, Dr Harris and Anne disagree over the best tactic for gathering intelligence on the aliens

programme.title: Thieves and Thugs
programme.desc: Nick Wallis shows how CCTV and technological advances are helping tackle the problem of violent crime, from burglaries to muggings and street fights. In west London, camera operators assist police as they try to enforce a drinking ban on a newly renovated park in Hammersmith, and later give guidance to officers after they spot a youth armed with a knife prowling the streets in the early hours

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Chuck
programme.desc: Bryce Larkin returns with news that Fulcrum has stolen a vital computer chip, which has fallen into the hands of well-to-do software magnate Von Hayes. To retrieve it, the agents must infiltrate Hayes's birthday party - but Chuck is irritated to discover the plan requires Sarah and Bryce to pose as an overly amorous married couple. Meanwhile, Lester faces a crisis when he starts work as assistant manager at Buy More

programme.title: Mystery Woman
programme.desc: Sleuthing bookshop-owner Samantha Kinsey investigates the suspicious death of a friend. The victim had earlier complained that her greedy relatives were trying to cut her out of her brother's will and the family business, and Samantha's inquiries unearth family secrets dating back to the Second World War. Mystery, starring Kellie Martin and Clarence Williams III

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: A practical joke turns into a murder mystery when a skeleton found on a tour bus turns out to be authentic. Mac and Stella are given the task of identifying the victim, but the evidence points to two periods in Times Square's history, 20 years apart. With Gary Sinise and Melina Kanakaredes

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: A diamond broker carrying a fortune in gems is murdered in an apparent road rage attack, and the only witness to the crime is a mentally disabled man. Meanwhile, Speedle and Delko are stunned when a teenage girl's body disappears en route to the morgue, and stumble across a family secret

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: A mathematical genius is shot dead and found with his index finger removed. The agents discover he was working on a code-breaking device that could make it possible to hack into any computer - but after finishing it had refused to pass the instrument over to the buyer. When Jane learns another whizz kid knows the whereabouts of the tool, he faces a race against time to stop it falling into the wrong hands. Crime drama, guest starring Lucy Davis (The Office) and Fisher Stevens (Lost)

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A former soldier comes to trial for the murder of a Yemeni immigrant he suspected of being a terrorist. With the events of September 11 still fresh in everyone's minds, McCoy tries to find a way of ensuring the jury's fears and prejudices do not influence their verdict. Award-winning police drama, starring Sam Waterston. Last in the series

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Mac gets caught in the middle of a shooting at a cafe while having breakfast, and finds himself torn between whether to pursue the gunman or help a waitress injured in the attack. As the team gives chase, he is presented with more personal decisions to make. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise and Melina Kanakaredes. Last in the series

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Horatio and the team continue their investigation into the murder of a porn star found strangled in a park. The finger of suspicion points to her agent, who has a distinctly seedy past, and Calleigh finds herself implicated by the discovery of a threatening answering-machine message she left for the victim. However, a forensic blunder puts the case in jeopardy - and Delko gets the blame. Last in the series

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: Reese has his work cut out trying to protect mob enforcer Riley Cavanaugh and his girlfriend after the hitman's boss takes out a million-dollar contract on them - but the task is complicated by Cavanaugh's tendency to shoot any pursuer. Finch receives an unusual request when he visits Elias in prison to ask for his help

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The shooting of a petty officer looks like an open-and-shut case when a Russian man is found with a recently fired gun in his car. However, the investigation takes a dramatic turn when it is revealed he is working as a spy for the Department of Homeland Security. Military crime drama, with Mark Harmon, Cote de Pablo and David McCallum

programme.title: Crank
programme.desc: Hitman Chev Chelios sets off in pursuit of a Chinese mobster who has removed his heart and replaced it with a machine requiring regular jolts of electricity to keep it working. As he tries to locate his missing organ, he must resort to increasingly elaborate methods of obtaining the necessary voltage to stay alive. Action thriller sequel, starring Jason Statham, Amy Smart, Dwight Yoakam and Efren Ramirez

programme.title: Justified
programme.desc: Boyd and Ava are forced to deal with Ellen May, who since losing her saviour Preacher Billy, has become a lost soul and wants to return `home' to her career in the brothel. Worried she will talk, Boyd arranges for her to go on a trip with Colt. Meanwhile, Raylan and Rachel look for fugitives Lindsey and Randall who, after stealing the marshal's stash of cash, are hoping to buy into the cock-fighting business

programme.title: Dark Blue
programme.desc: Carter is given one last chance to snare Garza, the head of a Mexican drug ring, and adopts the persona of a successful adult-film producer who wants to do a deal with the criminal. Maria is asked to make an exchange, but the danger forces Dean to make an unexpected confession to her father, which jeopardises the case

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Chuck
programme.desc: Sarah unexpectedly bumps into Heather Chandler, a girl who made her teenage years miserable. The pair recall their younger days, but Chuck notices something unusual about Heather's husband Mark - and discovers there may be a sinister reason why their paths have crossed. Meanwhile, Lester's new sales tactics cause havoc at Buy More. Guest starring Nicole Richie (The Simple Life) and Ben Savage (Boy Meets World)

programme.title: McBride
programme.desc: The crusading lawyer gets involved in the case of a murdered violin prodigy. The dead musician's father is convinced her fiance was responsible, but McBride comes to his defence, and discovers the victim had a number of rivals who had the motive to kill her. Mystery, starring John Larroquette and Matt Lutz

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Mac and Stella investigate the fatal shooting of a mounted police officer - but the only evidence is a bullet lodged in his horse, presenting them with a dilemma. Aiden takes on the case of a dead youth discovered with severe facial burns, and soon finds herself trying to crack an illegal betting operation

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: When a celebrity photographer is found dead in his car, Horatio and the team rule out the possibility of it being an accident, as all the evidence points to the involvement of a Hollywood star captured in a compromising position by the paparazzo. Drama, starring David Caruso and Emily Procter

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: The leader of an organisation dedicated to eradicating human trafficking is killed before making an important speech, leading the agents to suspect the killer was desperate to stop the presentation. Self-proclaimed psychic Kristina Frye joins the team to help with the investigation, and soon discovers the victim was going to expose a shocking truth about his own association. Guest starring Leslie Hope (24) and Eugene Byrd (Heroes), with Simon Baker

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the fatal shooting of two professors, which occurred soon after one of the academics campaigned against the treatment of women in the Middle East. Their inquiries lead them to a Muslim with strong beliefs - and an extreme dislike of females. Crime drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Horatio and his colleagues investigate a youngster's abduction and find themselves drawn into a dangerous situation at a jeweller's shop while trying to track down the kidnappers. A gun battle ensues - and a member of the team is killed in the line of duty

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the case of a skyscraper climber who plummeted from the Empire State Building. Returning to the floor from which he fell, Mac and Flack discover the dead man may have witnessed a murder. Meanwhile, Stella and Danny look into the killing of a fashion designer

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: The head of a notorious Puerto Rican gang is found dead outside a hotel shortly after his predecessor is released from jail. Mac is forced to use his diplomatic skills to prevent a revenge attack - but a second death and an ambush on a police car lead him to believe the killer is a disgruntled insider. Drama, starring Gary Sinise, with Edward James Olmos (Battlestar Galactica, Blade Runner)

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane and the team investigate a death threat, but find themselves in danger when a building explodes. Meanwhile, Lisbon confronts billionaire Walter Mashburn again when they meet during a case. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker and Robin Tunney

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Jane is kidnapped, but as Lisbon and the team go back over his previous cases in search of clues to the abductor's identity, they realise he had numerous enemies, any one of whom might be responsible. Crime drama, starring Robin Tunney and Simon Baker

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: The body of a former boxing star is found floating in the swimming pool of a brothel. However, with several feasible causes of death - punctures to the neck, a blow to the head and a likely poisoning - it proves almost impossible to pinpoint a suspect. Guest starring Peter Stormare (Prison Break)

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Chuck
programme.desc: An international terrorist arrives at Buy More looking for Jeff - leading Chuck to discover his hapless colleague has a surprisingly valuable hidden talent for playing one of the most popular video games of the 1980s. Meanwhile, the company's new efficiency expert makes a nuisance of himself on the shop floor. Guest starring Tony Hale (Arrested Development)

programme.title: Nora Roberts' Tribute (2009)
programme.desc: A former child star begins a relationship with her new neighbour while restoring her grandmother's old house. She is haunted by disturbing dreams that compel her to unravel the truth behind her grandmother's death, supposedly from a drug overdose, 30 years previously. Romantic mystery, with Brittany Murphy, Jason Lewis, Christian Oliver, Diana Scarwid and Tippi Hedren

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Mac and Stella trail a killer around Brooklyn while investigating the murder of a man whose body was dumped on a subway track. Their only lead is a woman seen in a home movie in the victim's flat. Danny looks into the death of a gallery owner with links to the Mob, and the corpse of a building labourer with a foul-smelling wound poses problems for Aiden and Flack. Guest starring Kelly Hu

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: An investigation into a fatal plane crash reveals the pilot died before the aircraft hit the ground. Evidence discovered at the scene points to the existence of a drugs ring, and the team finds itself entering the murky underbelly of a seemingly ordinary suburb to solve the case

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Police believe a college student was the latest victim of Red John, prompting Kristina Frye to make a televised appeal for the elusive murderer to come forward. Remembering how his own TV appearance led to the death of his family, a furious Jane tries to protect the self-proclaimed psychic - only to discover the serial killer may be one step ahead of him. Crime drama, starring Simon Baker, with Leslie Hope (24). Last in the series

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The team investigates the stabbing of a teacher whose body has been found in a caretaker's cupboard. The hunt for her killer leads to the discovery that she was caught up in a love triangle at school involving a student with multiple identities. Legal drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: A man arrested for a shooting decides to represent himself in court - and proves to be far more formidable than expected. Horatio realises the only thing that can put him behind bars is the eyewitness testimony of the victim's son, but is reluctant to put the boy on the stand

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Mac and Hawkes look into the murder of a prominent plastic surgeon, and discover several patients might have held grudges against him. Meanwhile, Danny and Stella investigate the case of a blind sculptor found strangled on a roof. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Part one of two. Ziva confronts her past when the team is ordered to protect her father, Mossad director Eli David, at a gathering of former heads of NCIS. The agents discover he is being targeted by terrorists who have hijacked a shipment of advanced weapons from the army. Drama, guest starring TJ Ramini and Michael Nouri, with Cote de Pablo and Michael Weatherly

programme.title: Played
programme.desc: CIU infiltrates a gang of masked bank robbers who are stealing money and killing security guards. Sent undercover, DC Price's focus is blurred when the leader's girlfriend starts flirting with him - and her partner is as possessive as he is unpredictable. As an inconvenient romance threatens to complicate issues, the team is forced into a risky play to take down the heist gang

programme.title: Longmire
programme.desc: The bodies of two Native Americans are found in a river, and the investigation leads to a Mexican drug smuggling cartel

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: The body of a woman is linked to a serial killer who induces comas in his victims and imprisons them. Taylor and Flack's team must piece together the evidence with the help of a survivor who can communicate only by blinking. With Gary Sinise, Melina Kanakaredes, Carmine Giovinazzo, Vanessa Ferlito and Eddie Cahill

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: The wife of a zealous defence lawyer is found dead in her car, but Briscoe and Green suspect the victim's husband was the real target, and set off on the trail of a former client - a convict who sent him threatening letters from jail. Award-winning police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Steven Hill

programme.title: Battle of the Bulge (1965)
programme.desc: A German tank commander is assigned to lead a surprise counter-attack against Allied forces as part of a last-ditch attempt to turn the tide of the Second World War and prevent the invasion of his country. An American intelligence officer realises what the enemy is planning, and tries to convince his superiors that they are facing a major offensive. Drama, starring Robert Shaw, Henry Fonda, Dana Andrews, Telly Savalas and Charles Bronson

programme.title: Pork Chop Hill (1959)
programme.desc: American troops fighting in Korea capture a strategically vital hill, but have difficulty defending it against enemy counter-attacks - and when reinforcements arrive, their numbers are too few to make much difference. Drama, starring Gregory Peck, Harry Guardino, Rip Torn, Woody Strode and George Peppard

programme.title: The Green Berets (1968)
programme.desc: A US Army colonel heads two squads of crack soldiers on a mission in the jungles of Vietnam, where they have to construct a camp to withstand attack and kidnap an enemy general. Accompanying him is a sceptical reporter, who questions the validity of the war. Military adventure, starring John Wayne, David Janssen, Jim Hutton and Aldo Ray

programme.title: Troy (2004)
programme.desc: A Trojan prince elopes with the king of Sparta's wife, sparking a bitter and bloody war between a mighty alliance of Greek kings and the city of Troy, whose champion engages in intense personal conflict with the enemy's most formidable warrior. Wolfgang Petersen's adventure, inspired by Homer's epic poem The Iliad, with Brad Pitt, Eric Bana, Orlando Bloom, Brian Cox, Sean Bean and Peter O'Toole

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Start your day with all the latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team

programme.title: Nightline
programme.desc: An incisive late-night news series that analyzes the day's top stories with interviews and reports. It occasionally features program-length documentaries, weeklong series and town-hall forums. The program began in November 1979 as 'The Iran Crisis: America Held Hostage', with Frank Reynolds anchoring. Ted Koppel took over shortly thereafter and it expanded its scope (and took the name 'Nightline') on March 24, 1980. Koppel served as anchor until 2005, when he was replaced by a troika of hosts

programme.title: This Old House
programme.desc: Renovation projects are undertaken to demonstrate home repair and building techniques in this Emmy-winning how-to program. Original host Bob Vila was replaced in 1989 after producers objected to his commercial endorsements. Steve Thomas took over until 2003, when he was replaced by Kevin O'Connor. Ace carpenter Norm Abram has been a staple of the show since its inception. Spin-offs include 'Ask This Old House,' while vintage episodes air on HGTV as 'This Old House Classics.'
